TEXT.English: [TAB]The galley was the first ship designed for war. Introduced by the Greeks, galleys were powered by banks of oars on each side, manned by well-trained oarsmen. These oarsmen were highly paid professionals or patriotic citizens, not slaves and prisoners as depicted in fiction. A huge, bronze "beak" mounted at the bow of the ship was used to ram and sink enemy ships. Because of its long, narrow hull, the galley was very unstable in all but the calmest waters, and as a consequence its crew rarely ventured out of sight of land for long periods of time, lest the ship be caught in a storm and sunk.
TEXT.French: [TAB]La galère fut le premier navire conçu pour la guerre. Crée par les Grecs, elle était propulsée par plusieurs rangs de rameurs bien entraînés, installés de chaque côté du bateau. Contrairement à ce que l'on pense, ces rameurs étaient des professionnels ou des volontaires, et non des esclaves ou des prisonniers. Un énorme "éperon" en bronze était fixé sur la proue pour éperonner et couler les navires ennemis. La longue coque étroite du bateau le rendait instable dès que la mer s'agitait un peu, et les équipages évitaient généralement de s'aventurer trop longtemps loin des côtes, de peur qu'une tempête survienne et coule le navire.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die von den Griechen in der Antike entworfene und gebaute Triere war das erste Kriegsschiff überhaupt. Auf beiden Seiten des Schiffes befanden sich Ruderbänke, an denen erfahrene Ruderer für volle Fahrt sorgten. Entgegen der häufig vertretenen Theorie, dass es sich dabei um Sklaven oder Gefangene handelte, bestand die Rudermannschaft normalerweise aus gut bezahlten, fachkundigen Seeleuten oder patriotischen Bürgern. Am Bug befand sich ein riesiger, meist aus Bronze gefertigter Schnabel, mit dessen Hilfe feindliche Schiffe gerammt und versenkt werden konnten. Da die Triere wegen ihres langen, schmalen Rumpfs bei rauer See sehr instabil wurde, entfernte sie sich selten weit von der Küste, denn jeder Sturm hätte ausgereicht, um sie zum Kentern zu bringen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La galea è stata la prima nave appositamente progettata per la guerra. Introdotta dai Greci, quest'imbarcazione si muoveva grazie alla presenza di file di remi su ciascun lato, utilizzati da rematori ben addestrati. Questi uomini erano professionisti con un ottimo salario o cittadini patriottici, non schiavi e prigionieri come si crede. Un grosso "rostro" di bronzo, montato sulla prua della nave, veniva utilizzato per colpire e affondare le navi nemiche. A causa del suo scafo lungo e stretto, la galea era molto instabile al di fuori delle acque placide: di conseguenza, l'equipaggio non perdeva mai di vista la costa, proprio per evitare pericoli durante la navigazione.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La galera fue el primer barco diseñado para la guerra. Inventadas por los griegos, las galeras contaban con bancos de remos a ambos lados, manejados por marineros avezados. Los remeros eran profesionales muy bien remunerados o patriotas, no los esclavos y prisioneros que aparecen en las películas. Un enorme ?espolón? de bronce instalado en la proa de la nave se utilizaba para embestir y hundir las embarcaciones enemigas. Debido a su casco alargado y de poco calado, la galera solo era estable en las aguas más tranquilas, y como consecuencia de ello, raramente se alejaba de la costa durante largos periodos de tiempo, no fuera a sucumbir en alguna tormenta.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Trade originated with the start of communication in prehistoric times. Trading was the main facility of prehistoric people, who bartered goods and services from each other. Peter Watson dates the history of long-distance commerce from circa 150,000 years ago. [PARAGRAPH:1]Trade is believed to have taken place throughout much of recorded human history. There is evidence of the exchange of obsidian and flint during the stone age. Materials used for creating jewelry were traded with Egypt since 3000 BCE The Phoenicians were noted sea traders, travelling across the Mediterranean Sea, and as far north as Britain for sources of tin to manufacture bronze. For this purpose they established trade colonies the Greeks called emporia. [PARAGRAPH:1]From the beginning of Greek civilization until the fall of the Roman empire in the 5th century, a financially lucrative trade brought valuable spice to Europe from the far east, including China. Roman commerce allowed their empire to flourish and endure. Their widespread empire produced a stable and secure transportation network that enabled the shipment of trade goods without fear of significant piracy. [PARAGRAPH:1]The fall of the Roman empire, and the succeeding dark ages brought instability to western europe and a near collapse of the trade network. Nevertheless some trade did occur. The Radhanites were a medieval guild of Jewish merchants who allowed trade between the Christians in Europe and the Muslims of the near east. [PARAGRAPH:1]From the 8th century to the 11th century centuries, the Vikings and Varangians traded as they sailed from and to Scandinavia. Vikings sailed to Western Europe, while Varangians to Russia. The Hanseatic League was an alliance of trading cities that maintained a trade monopoly over most of Northern Europe and the Baltic, between the 13th and 17th centuries. [PARAGRAPH:1]The tales of Marco Polo's travels to the far east sparked an interest in the spice trade. Vasco da Gama started the Spice trade in 1498. The spice trade was of major economic importance and helped spur the Age of Exploration. Spices brought to Europe from distant lands were some of the most valuable commodities for their weight, sometimes rivaling gold. [PARAGRAPH:1]In the 16th century, Holland was the centre of free trade, imposing no exchange controls, and advocating the free movement of goods. [PARAGRAPH:1]Trade in the East Indies was dominated by Portugal in the 16th century, the Netherlands in the 17th century, and the British in the 18th century.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le commerce naissait avec le début de communication aux temps préhistoriques. Le commerce était la facilité principale des gens préhistoriques, qui ont troqué des marchandises et des services l'un de l'autre. Peter Watson date l'histoire de commerce à longue distance d'il y a environ 150,000 ans. [PARAGRAPH:1]On croit que le commerce est survenu partout dans une grande partie d'histoire humaine enregistrée. Il y a l'évidence de l'échange d'obsidian et le silex pendant l'âge de pierre. Le matériel utilisé pour créer la bijouterie a été échangé avec l'Egypte depuis 3000 BCE les Phéniciens ont été notés les commerçants marins, voyageant à travers la Méditerranée et comme le nord lointain comme la Grande-Bretagne pour les sources de boîte pour fabriquer du bronze. Pour ce but ils ont établi des colonies commerciales les Grecs appelés le grand magasin. [PARAGRAPH:1]À partir du début de civilisation grecque jusqu'à la chute de l'empire romain au 5ème siècle, un commerce financièrement lucratif a apporté l'épice de valeur en Europe de l'Extrême-Orient, en incluant la Chine. Le commerce romain a permis à leur empire de prospérer et endurer. Leur empire étendu a produit un réseau de transport ferme et sûr qui a permis le chargement de marchandises commerciales sans peur de piratage significatif. [PARAGRAPH:1]La chute de l'empire romain et du Moyen Age réussissant a apporté l'instabilité en Europe occidentale et un près de l'effondrement du réseau commercial. Quand même un peu de commerce s'est vraiment produit. Les Radhanites étaient une guilde médiévale de négociants juifs qui ont permis le commerce entre les Chrétiens en Europe et les Musulmans du Proche-Orient. [PARAGRAPH:1]Du 8ème siècle aux siècles du 11ème siècle, les Vikings et Varangians ont fait du commerce comme ils ont navigué d'et à Scandinavie. Les Vikings ont navigué en Europe occidentale, pendant que Varangians en Russie. La Ligue hanséatique était une alliance de villes commerciales qui ont maintenu un monopole commercial sur la plupart d'Europe septentrionale et le Balte, entre les 13ème et 17ème siècles. [PARAGRAPH:1]Les histoires des voyages de Marco Polo dans l'Extrême-Orient ont suscité un intérêt pour le commerce d'épice. Vasco da Gama a commencé le commerce d'Épice dans 1498. Le commerce d'épice a été de l'importance économique importante et a aidé à encourager l'Âge d'Exploration. Les épices apportées en Europe des terrains lointains étaient certains des articles les plus de valeur pour leur poids, en égalant quelquefois de l'or. [PARAGRAPH:1]Au 16ème siècle, les Pays-Bas étaient le centre de libre-échange, n'en imposant aucunes commandes de change et en recommandant le mouvement libre de marchandises. [PARAGRAPH:1]Le commerce dans l'Indies Est a été dominé par le Portugal au 16ème siècle, les Pays-Bas au 17ème siècle et les Britanniques au 18ème siècle.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Handel entstand mit dem Anfang der Kommunikation in der Vorgeschichte. Der Handel war die Hauptmöglichkeit von vorgeschichtlichen Leuten, die Waren und Dienstleistungen von einander umtauschten. Peter Watson datiert auf die Geschichte des Langstreckenhandels von um vor 150,000 Jahren. [PARAGRAPH:1]Wie man glaubt, hat Handel überall in viel registrierter menschlicher Geschichte stattgefunden. Es gibt Beweise des Austausches von obsidian und Zündstein während der Steinzeit. Materialien verwendet, um Schmucksachen zu schaffen, wurden mit Ägypten seit 3000 BCE getauscht Die Phönizier waren bemerkte Seehändler, über Mittelmeer, und als weiter Norden als Großbritannien für Quellen von Dose reisend, um Bronze zu verfertigen. Zu diesem Zweck gründeten sie Handelskolonien, die die Griechen emporia nannten. [PARAGRAPH:1]Vom Anfang der griechischen Zivilisation bis zum Fall des römischen Reiches im 5. Jahrhundert brachte ein finanziell lukrativer Handel wertvolles Gewürz nach Europa vom Fernen Osten einschließlich Chinas. Römischer Handel erlaubte ihrem Reich, zu gedeihen und anzudauern. Ihr weit verbreitetes Reich erzeugte ein stabiles und sicheres Transport-Netz, das die Sendung von Handelswaren ohne Angst vor der bedeutenden illegalen Vervielfältigung ermöglichte. [PARAGRAPH:1]Der Fall des römischen Reiches, und des folgenden finsteren Mittelalters brachte Instabilität nach Westeuropa und einen nahen Zusammenbruch des Handelsnetzes. Dennoch kam etwas Handel wirklich vor. Die Radhanites waren eine mittelalterliche Innung von jüdischen Großhändlern, die Handel zwischen den Christen in Europa und den Moslems des Nahen Ostens erlaubten. [PARAGRAPH:1]Vom 8. Jahrhundert bis zu den Jahrhunderten des 11. Jahrhunderts den Wikingern und getauschtem Varangians wie segelten sie von und bis Skandinavien. Wikinger segelten nach Westeuropa, während Varangians nach Russland. Die Hanse war eine Verbindung von Handelsstädten, die ein Handelsmonopol über den grössten Teil Nordeuropas und die Ostsee zwischen den 13. und 17. Jahrhunderten aufrechterhielten. [PARAGRAPH:1]Die Märchen des Reisens von Marco Polo nach dem Fernen Osten befeuerten ein Interesse am Gewürz-Handel. Vasco da Gama fing den Gewürz-Handel mit 1498 an. Der Gewürz-Handel war von Hauptwirtschaftswichtigkeit und half, das Alter der Erforschung zu spornen. Gewürze gebracht nach Europa von entfernten Ländern waren einige der wertvollsten Waren für ihr Gewicht, manchmal mit Gold konkurrierend. [PARAGRAPH:1]Im 16. Jahrhundert war Holland das Zentrum des Freihandels, keine Devisenbewirtschaftungen auferlegend, und die freie Bewegung von Waren verteidigend. [PARAGRAPH:1]Der Handel mit dem Östlichen Indies wurde durch Portugal im 16. Jahrhundert, die Niederlande im 17. Jahrhundert, und die Briten im 18. Jahrhundert beherrscht.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il mestiere ha provenuto con l'inizio di comunicazione nei tempi preistorici. Il commercio era la facilità principale di persone preistoriche, che ha barattato le merci ed i servizi da l'un l'altro. Peter Watson data la storia di commercio di lungo-distanza da intorno a 150.000 anni fa. [PARAGRAPH:1]Il mestiere è creduto avere avuto luogo in ogni parte molto di storia registrata umana. Ci è la prova dello scambio di obsidian e la selce durante l'età della pietra. I materiali usati per la gioielleria di creare sono stato commerciati con Egitto poiché 3000 BCE che Il Phoenicians sono stato notati i commercianti di mare, viaggiando attraverso il Mare mediterraneo, ed il come estremo nord come Gran Bretagna per le fonti di stagno di fabbricare il bronzo. A questo scopo hanno stabilito le colonie di mestiere i greci hanno chiamato degli empori. [PARAGRAPH:1]Dall'inizio di civilizzazione greca fino alla caduta dell'impero romano nel secolo 5, un mestiere finanziariamente lucroso ha portato lo spice di valore a Europa dall'estremo oriente, includendo Cina. Il commercio romano ha consentito il loro impero prosperare e perseverare. Il loro impero esteso ha prodotto una stalla ed ottiene il network di trasporto che ha permesso la spedizione di merci di mestiere senza la paura di pirateria significativa. [PARAGRAPH:1]La caduta dell'impero romano, ed il che riuscindo età oscura ha portato l'instabilità a Europa occidentale ed un collasso prossimo del network di mestiere. Tuttavia del mestiere è accaduto. Il Radhanites erano una corporazione medievale di commercianti Ebrei che ha consentito il mestiere tra i cristiani in europa ed i Musulmani del si avvicina all'est. [PARAGRAPH:1]Dal secolo 8 ai secoli di secolo 11, il Vikings e Varangians hanno commerciato come hanno navigato da ed a Scandinavia. Il Vikings ha navigato a Europa Occidentale, mentre Varangians a Russia. La Lega di Hanseatic era un'alleanza di città commerciali che ha mantenuto un monopolio di mestiere sopra la maggior parte di Europa del nord ed il Baltico, tra i secoli 13 e 17. [PARAGRAPH:1]Le favole di viaggi del Polo di Marco all'estremo oriente hanno acceso un interesse nel mestiere di spice. Gama di da di Vasco ha cominciato il mestiere di Spice in 1498. Il mestiere di spice era di maggiore importanza economica e lo sperone aiutato l'Età di Esplorazione. Lo Spices ha portato a Europa dalle terre distanti erano alcuni delle merci più di valore per il loro peso, il loro a volte oro di rivaling. [PARAGRAPH:1]Nel secolo 16, Olanda era il centro di libero commercio, imponendo nessuni controlli di scambio, e difendere il movimento libero di merci. [PARAGRAPH:1]Commerciare nell'Indie Orientale è stato dominato da Portogallo nel secolo 16, Paesi Bassi nel secolo 17, e gli inglesi nel secolo 18.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El comercio provino con el principio de comunicación en tiempos prehistóricos. El comercio era la instalación principal de la gente prehistórica, que cambió bienes y servicios el uno del otro. Peter Watson data la historia del comercio de fondo de hacia hace 150,000 años. [PARAGRAPH:1]Se cree que el comercio ha ocurrido en todas partes de la mayor parte de la historia humana registrada. Hay pruebas del cambio de obsidiana y sílex durante la Edad de Piedra. Los materiales usados para crear joyería fueron cambiados con Egipto desde 3000 BCE los Fenicios fueron notados comerciantes de mar, que viajan a través del Mar Mediterráneo, y como el norte lejano como Gran Bretaña para fuentes de lata para fabricar el bronce. Para este fin ellos establecieron colonias comerciales los griegos llamados emporios. [PARAGRAPH:1]A partir del principio de la civilización griega hasta la caída del Imperio romano en el 5o siglo, un comercio económicamente lucrativo trajo la especia valiosa a Europa del oriente lejano, incluso China. El comercio romano permitió que su Imperio prosperara y durara. Su Imperio extendido produjo una red de transporte estable y segura que permitió el envío de bienes comerciales sin el miedo de la piratería significativa. [PARAGRAPH:1]La caída del Imperio romano, y la Alta Edad Media sucesiva trajo la inestabilidad a Europa occidental y un cerca del colapso de la red comercial. Sin embargo un poco de comercio ocurrió realmente. Los Radhanites eran un gremio medieval de comerciantes judíos que permitieron el comercio entre los Cristianos en Europa y los Musulmanes del Oriente Próximo. [PARAGRAPH:1]Del 8o siglo a los siglos del 11o siglo, los Vikingos y Varangians cambiado cuando ellos fueron en barco de y a Escandinavia. Los vikingos fueron en barco a Europa Occidental, mientras Varangians a Rusia. La Liga Hanseatic era una alianza de ciudades comerciales que mantuvieron un monopolio comercial sobre la mayor parte de Europa del Norte y el Báltico, entre los 13os y 17os siglos. [PARAGRAPH:1]Los cuentos de los viajes de Marco Polo al oriente lejano provocaron un interés al comercio de especia. Vasco da Gama comenzó el comercio de Especia en 1498. El comercio de especia tuvo la importancia económica principal y ayudó a espolear la Edad de Exploración. Las especias traídas a Europa de tierras distantes eran algunas materias más valiosas para su peso, a veces rivalizando con el oro. [PARAGRAPH:1]En el 16o siglo, Holanda era el centro de cambio libre, no imponiendo ningunos controles de divisas, y abogando por el movimiento libre de bienes. [PARAGRAPH:1]El comercio en Indies del este fue dominado por Portugal en el 16o siglo, los Países Bajos en el 17o siglo, y el Británico en el 18o siglo.

[PARAGRAPH:1]Dall'inizio di civilizzazione greca fino alla caduta dell'impero romano nel secolo 5, un mestiere finanziariamente lucroso ha portato lo spice di valore a Europa dall'estremo oriente, includendo Cina. Il commercio romano ha consentito il loro impero prosperare e perseverare. Il loro impero esteso ha prodotto una stalla ed ottiene il network di trasporto che ha permesso la spedizione di merci di mestiere senza la paura di pirateria significativa. [PARAGRAPH:1]La caduta dell'impero romano, ed il che riuscindo età oscura ha portato l'instabilità a Europa occidentale ed un collasso prossimo del network di mestiere. Tuttavia del mestiere è accaduto. Il Radhanites erano una corporazione medievale di commercianti Ebrei che ha consentito il mestiere tra i cristiani in europa ed i Musulmani del si avvicina all'est. [PARAGRAPH:1]Dal secolo 8 ai secoli di secolo 11, il Vikings e Varangians hanno commerciato come hanno navigato da ed a Scandinavia. Il Vikings ha navigato a Europa Occidentale, mentre Varangians a Russia. La Lega di Hanseatic era un'alleanza di città commerciali che ha mantenuto un monopolio di mestiere sopra la maggior parte di Europa del nord ed il Baltico, tra i secoli 13 e 17. [PARAGRAPH:1]Le favole di viaggi del Polo di Marco all'estremo oriente hanno acceso un interesse nel mestiere di spice. Gama di da di Vasco ha cominciato il mestiere di Spice in 1498. Il mestiere di spice era di maggiore importanza economica e lo sperone aiutato l'Età di Esplorazione. Lo Spices ha portato a Europa dalle terre distanti erano alcuni delle merci più di valore per il loro peso, il loro a volte oro di rivaling. [PARAGRAPH:1]Nel secolo 16, Olanda era il centro di libero commercio, imponendo nessuni controlli di scambio, e difendere il movimento libero di merci. [PARAGRAPH:1]Commerciare nell'Indie Orientale è stato dominato da Portogallo nel secolo 16, Paesi Bassi nel secolo 17, e gli inglesi nel secolo 18.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El comercio provino con el principio de comunicación en tiempos prehistóricos. El comercio era la instalación principal de la gente prehistórica, que cambió bienes y servicios el uno del otro. Peter Watson data la historia del comercio de fondo de hacia hace 150,000 años. [PARAGRAPH:1]Se cree que el comercio ha ocurrido en todas partes de la mayor parte de la historia humana registrada. Hay pruebas del cambio de obsidiana y sílex durante la Edad de Piedra. Los materiales usados para crear joyería fueron cambiados con Egipto desde 3000 BCE los Fenicios fueron notados comerciantes de mar, que viajan a través del Mar Mediterráneo, y como el norte lejano como Gran Bretaña para fuentes de lata para fabricar el bronce. Para este fin ellos establecieron colonias comerciales los griegos llamados emporios. [PARAGRAPH:1]A partir del principio de la civilización griega hasta la caída del Imperio romano en el 5o siglo, un comercio económicamente lucrativo trajo la especia valiosa a Europa del oriente lejano, incluso China. El comercio romano permitió que su Imperio prosperara y durara. Su Imperio extendido produjo una red de transporte estable y segura que permitió el envío de bienes comerciales sin el miedo de la piratería significativa. [PARAGRAPH:1]La caída del Imperio romano, y la Alta Edad Media sucesiva trajo la inestabilidad a Europa occidental y un cerca del colapso de la red comercial. Sin embargo un poco de comercio ocurrió realmente. Los Radhanites eran un gremio medieval de comerciantes judíos que permitieron el comercio entre los Cristianos en Europa y los Musulmanes del Oriente Próximo. [PARAGRAPH:1]Del 8o siglo a los siglos del 11o siglo, los Vikingos y Varangians cambiado cuando ellos fueron en barco de y a Escandinavia. Los vikingos fueron en barco a Europa Occidental, mientras Varangians a Rusia. La Liga Hanseatic era una alianza de ciudades comerciales que mantuvieron un monopolio comercial sobre la mayor parte de Europa del Norte y el Báltico, entre los 13os y 17os siglos. [PARAGRAPH:1]Los cuentos de los viajes de Marco Polo al oriente lejano provocaron un interés al comercio de especia. Vasco da Gama comenzó el comercio de Especia en 1498. El comercio de especia tuvo la importancia económica principal y ayudó a espolear la Edad de Exploración. Las especias traídas a Europa de tierras distantes eran algunas materias más valiosas para su peso, a veces rivalizando con el oro. [PARAGRAPH:1]En el 16o siglo, Holanda era el centro de cambio libre, no imponiendo ningunos controles de divisas, y abogando por el movimiento libre de bienes. [PARAGRAPH:1]El comercio en Indies del este fue dominado por Portugal en el 16o siglo, los Países Bajos en el 17o siglo, y el Británico en el 18o siglo.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A minstrel was a medieval European bard who performed songs whose lyrics told stories about distant places or about (real or imaginary) historical events. Though minstrels created their own tales, often they would memorize and embellish the works of others. As the courts became more sophisticated, minstrels were eventually replaced at court by the troubadours, and many became wandering minstrels, performing for common townsfolk. In this guise, minstrelsy was still well liked until the middle of the Renaissance, despite its steady decline since the late 15th century.[PARAGRAPH:1]Initially, minstrels were simply servants at Court (the name means literally "little servant"), and entertained the lord and courtiers with chansons de geste or their local equivalent. The term minstrel derives from Old French menestrel, menesterel, menestral, French ménestral, Italian ministrello, menestrello, from Middle Latin ministralis, ministrel, "retainer," Latin minister, "attendant," "retainer," "minister," from minor, "less."[PARAGRAPH:1]In England before the Norman Conquest, the professional poet was known as a scôp ("shaper" or "maker"), who composed his own poems, and sang them to the accompaniment of a rude harp. Another type of performers, in a rank much beneath the scôp, were the gleemen, who had no settled abode, but roamed about from place to place, earning what they could from their performances. Late in the 13th century, the term minstrel began to be used to designate a performer who amused his lord with music and song.[PARAGRAPH:1]In a complex way involving invasions, wars, conquests, etc., two categories of composers originated. Poets like Chaucer and John Gower appeared in one category wherein music was not a part. Minstrels, on the other hand, swarmed at feasts and festivals in great numbers with harps, fiddles, bagpipes, flutes, flageolets, citterns, and kettledrums.[PARAGRAPH:1]As early as 1321, the minstrels of Paris were formed into a guild. A guild of royal minstrels was organized in England in 1469. Minstrels were required to either join the guild or to abstain from practicing their craft. Some minstrels were retained by lords as jesters who, in some cases, also practiced the art of juggling. Some were women, or women who followed minstrels in their travels. Minstrels throughout Europe also employed trained animals, such as bears. Minstrelsy in Europe died out slowly, having gone nearly extinct by about 1700, though isolated individuals working in the tradition were said to exist well into the 19th century.[PARAGRAPH:1]The term minstrelsy was revived in the 1840s United States to refer to blackface performances known as minstrel shows.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le commerce naissait avec le début de communication aux temps préhistoriques. Le commerce était la facilité principale des gens préhistoriques, qui ont troqué des marchandises et des services l'un de l'autre. Peter Watson date l'histoire de commerce à longue distance d'il y a environ 150,000 ans. [PARAGRAPH:1]On croit que le commerce est survenu partout dans une grande partie d'histoire humaine enregistrée. Il y a l'évidence de l'échange d'obsidian et le silex pendant l'âge de pierre. Le matériel utilisé pour créer la bijouterie a été échangé avec l'Egypte depuis 3000 BCE les Phéniciens ont été notés les commerçants marins, voyageant à travers la Méditerranée et comme le nord lointain comme la Grande-Bretagne pour les sources de boîte pour fabriquer du bronze. Pour ce but ils ont établi des colonies commerciales les Grecs appelés le grand magasin. [PARAGRAPH:1]À partir du début de civilisation grecque jusqu'à la chute de l'empire romain au 5ème siècle, un commerce financièrement lucratif a apporté l'épice de valeur en Europe de l'Extrême-Orient, en incluant la Chine. Le commerce romain a permis à leur empire de prospérer et endurer. Leur empire étendu a produit un réseau de transport ferme et sûr qui a permis le chargement de marchandises commerciales sans peur de piratage significatif. [PARAGRAPH:1]La chute de l'empire romain et du Moyen Age réussissant a apporté l'instabilité en Europe occidentale et un près de l'effondrement du réseau commercial. Quand même un peu de commerce s'est vraiment produit. Les Radhanites étaient une guilde médiévale de négociants juifs qui ont permis le commerce entre les Chrétiens en Europe et les Musulmans du Proche-Orient. [PARAGRAPH:1]Du 8ème siècle aux siècles du 11ème siècle, les Vikings et Varangians ont fait du commerce comme ils ont navigué d'et à Scandinavie. Les Vikings ont navigué en Europe occidentale, pendant que Varangians en Russie. La Ligue hanséatique était une alliance de villes commerciales qui ont maintenu un monopole commercial sur la plupart d'Europe septentrionale et le Balte, entre les 13ème et 17ème siècles. [PARAGRAPH:1]Les histoires des voyages de Marco Polo dans l'Extrême-Orient ont suscité un intérêt pour le commerce d'épice. Vasco da Gama a commencé le commerce d'Épice dans 1498. Le commerce d'épice a été de l'importance économique importante et a aidé à encourager l'Âge d'Exploration. Les épices apportées en Europe des terrains lointains étaient certains des articles les plus de valeur pour leur poids, en égalant quelquefois de l'or. [PARAGRAPH:1]Au 16ème siècle, les Pays-Bas étaient le centre de libre-échange, n'en imposant aucunes commandes de change et en recommandant le mouvement libre de marchandises. [PARAGRAPH:1]Le commerce dans l'Indies Est a été dominé par le Portugal au 16ème siècle, les Pays-Bas au 17ème siècle et les Britanniques au 18ème siècle.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Handel entstand mit dem Anfang der Kommunikation in der Vorgeschichte. Der Handel war die Hauptmöglichkeit von vorgeschichtlichen Leuten, die Waren und Dienstleistungen von einander umtauschten. Peter Watson datiert auf die Geschichte des Langstreckenhandels von um vor 150,000 Jahren. [PARAGRAPH:1]Wie man glaubt, hat Handel überall in viel registrierter menschlicher Geschichte stattgefunden. Es gibt Beweise des Austausches von obsidian und Zündstein während der Steinzeit. Materialien verwendet, um Schmucksachen zu schaffen, wurden mit Ägypten seit 3000 BCE getauscht Die Phönizier waren bemerkte Seehändler, über Mittelmeer, und als weiter Norden als Großbritannien für Quellen von Dose reisend, um Bronze zu verfertigen. Zu diesem Zweck gründeten sie Handelskolonien, die die Griechen emporia nannten. [PARAGRAPH:1]Vom Anfang der griechischen Zivilisation bis zum Fall des römischen Reiches im 5. Jahrhundert brachte ein finanziell lukrativer Handel wertvolles Gewürz nach Europa vom Fernen Osten einschließlich Chinas. Römischer Handel erlaubte ihrem Reich, zu gedeihen und anzudauern. Ihr weit verbreitetes Reich erzeugte ein stabiles und sicheres Transport-Netz, das die Sendung von Handelswaren ohne Angst vor der bedeutenden illegalen Vervielfältigung ermöglichte. [PARAGRAPH:1]Der Fall des römischen Reiches, und des folgenden finsteren Mittelalters brachte Instabilität nach Westeuropa und einen nahen Zusammenbruch des Handelsnetzes. Dennoch kam etwas Handel wirklich vor. Die Radhanites waren eine mittelalterliche Innung von jüdischen Großhändlern, die Handel zwischen den Christen in Europa und den Moslems des Nahen Ostens erlaubten. [PARAGRAPH:1]Vom 8. Jahrhundert bis zu den Jahrhunderten des 11. Jahrhunderts den Wikingern und getauschtem Varangians wie segelten sie von und bis Skandinavien. Wikinger segelten nach Westeuropa, während Varangians nach Russland. Die Hanse war eine Verbindung von Handelsstädten, die ein Handelsmonopol über den grössten Teil Nordeuropas und die Ostsee zwischen den 13. und 17. Jahrhunderten aufrechterhielten. [PARAGRAPH:1]Die Märchen des Reisens von Marco Polo nach dem Fernen Osten befeuerten ein Interesse am Gewürz-Handel. Vasco da Gama fing den Gewürz-Handel mit 1498 an. Der Gewürz-Handel war von Hauptwirtschaftswichtigkeit und half, das Alter der Erforschung zu spornen. Gewürze gebracht nach Europa von entfernten Ländern waren einige der wertvollsten Waren für ihr Gewicht, manchmal mit Gold konkurrierend. [PARAGRAPH:1]Im 16. Jahrhundert war Holland das Zentrum des Freihandels, keine Devisenbewirtschaftungen auferlegend, und die freie Bewegung von Waren verteidigend. [PARAGRAPH:1]Der Handel mit dem Östlichen Indies wurde durch Portugal im 16. Jahrhundert, die Niederlande im 17. Jahrhundert, und die Briten im 18. Jahrhundert beherrscht.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il mestiere ha provenuto con l'inizio di comunicazione nei tempi preistorici. Il commercio era la facilità principale di persone preistoriche, che ha barattato le merci ed i servizi da l'un l'altro. Peter Watson data la storia di commercio di lungo-distanza da intorno a 150.000 anni fa. [PARAGRAPH:1]Il mestiere è creduto avere avuto luogo in ogni parte molto di storia registrata umana. Ci è la prova dello scambio di obsidian e la selce durante l'età della pietra. I materiali usati per la gioielleria di creare sono stato commerciati con Egitto poiché 3000 BCE che Il Phoenicians sono stato notati i commercianti di mare, viaggiando attraverso il Mare mediterraneo, ed il come estremo nord come Gran Bretagna per le fonti di stagno di fabbricare il bronzo. A questo scopo hanno stabilito le colonie di mestiere i greci hanno chiamato degli empori. [PARAGRAPH:1]Dall'inizio di civilizzazione greca fino alla caduta dell'impero romano nel secolo 5, un mestiere finanziariamente lucroso ha portato lo spice di valore a Europa dall'estremo oriente, includendo Cina. Il commercio romano ha consentito il loro impero prosperare e perseverare. Il loro impero esteso ha prodotto una stalla ed ottiene il network di trasporto che ha permesso la spedizione di merci di mestiere senza la paura di pirateria significativa. [PARAGRAPH:1]La caduta dell'impero romano, ed il che riuscindo età oscura ha portato l'instabilità a Europa occidentale ed un collasso prossimo del network di mestiere. Tuttavia del mestiere è accaduto. Il Radhanites erano una corporazione medievale di commercianti Ebrei che ha consentito il mestiere tra i cristiani in europa ed i Musulmani del si avvicina all'est. [PARAGRAPH:1]Dal secolo 8 ai secoli di secolo 11, il Vikings e Varangians hanno commerciato come hanno navigato da ed a Scandinavia. Il Vikings ha navigato a Europa Occidentale, mentre Varangians a Russia. La Lega di Hanseatic era un'alleanza di città commerciali che ha mantenuto un monopolio di mestiere sopra la maggior parte di Europa del nord ed il Baltico, tra i secoli 13 e 17. [PARAGRAPH:1]Le favole di viaggi del Polo di Marco all'estremo oriente hanno acceso un interesse nel mestiere di spice. Gama di da di Vasco ha cominciato il mestiere di Spice in 1498. Il mestiere di spice era di maggiore importanza economica e lo sperone aiutato l'Età di Esplorazione. Lo Spices ha portato a Europa dalle terre distanti erano alcuni delle merci più di valore per il loro peso, il loro a volte oro di rivaling. [PARAGRAPH:1]Nel secolo 16, Olanda era il centro di libero commercio, imponendo nessuni controlli di scambio, e difendere il movimento libero di merci. [PARAGRAPH:1]Commerciare nell'Indie Orientale è stato dominato da Portogallo nel secolo 16, Paesi Bassi nel secolo 17, e gli inglesi nel secolo 18.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Shipping is the transport of cargo between seaports by ships, typically large steel vessels powered by diesel engines or steam turbine plants. Many nations have built specialized naval ships to ensure the free movement of legitimate cargo; these "merchant navies" are essential to the world economy, carrying the bulk of international trade. The ships are also extremely expensive constructions themselves, being some of the largest man-made vehicles ever. The term originates with the shipping trade of wind power ships, and has come to refer to the delivery of cargo and parcels of any size above the common mail of letters and postcards.[PARAGRAPH:1]Most cargo transport is by shipping rather than by air transport because shipping is cheaper. Air transport is usually reserved for products which must be sent within a certain time frame.[PARAGRAPH:1]Shipping can more generally refer to the transport of freight ("shipments"), independent of the mode of transport. An example would be Less-Than-Truckload (LTL) Shipping, where the primary mode of transport is by truck.

Gewürze gebracht nach Europa von entfernten Ländern waren einige der wertvollsten Waren für ihr Gewicht, manchmal mit Gold konkurrierend. [PARAGRAPH:1]Im 16. Jahrhundert war Holland das Zentrum des Freihandels, keine Devisenbewirtschaftungen auferlegend, und die freie Bewegung von Waren verteidigend. [PARAGRAPH:1]Der Handel mit dem Östlichen Indies wurde durch Portugal im 16. Jahrhundert, die Niederlande im 17. Jahrhundert, und die Briten im 18. Jahrhundert beherrscht.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il mestiere ha provenuto con l'inizio di comunicazione nei tempi preistorici. Il commercio era la facilità principale di persone preistoriche, che ha barattato le merci ed i servizi da l'un l'altro. Peter Watson data la storia di commercio di lungo-distanza da intorno a 150.000 anni fa. [PARAGRAPH:1]Il mestiere è creduto avere avuto luogo in ogni parte molto di storia registrata umana. Ci è la prova dello scambio di obsidian e la selce durante l'età della pietra. I materiali usati per la gioielleria di creare sono stato commerciati con Egitto poiché 3000 BCE che Il Phoenicians sono stato notati i commercianti di mare, viaggiando attraverso il Mare mediterraneo, ed il come estremo nord come Gran Bretagna per le fonti di stagno di fabbricare il bronzo. A questo scopo hanno stabilito le colonie di mestiere i greci hanno chiamato degli empori. [PARAGRAPH:1]Dall'inizio di civilizzazione greca fino alla caduta dell'impero romano nel secolo 5, un mestiere finanziariamente lucroso ha portato lo spice di valore a Europa dall'estremo oriente, includendo Cina. Il commercio romano ha consentito il loro impero prosperare e perseverare. Il loro impero esteso ha prodotto una stalla ed ottiene il network di trasporto che ha permesso la spedizione di merci di mestiere senza la paura di pirateria significativa. [PARAGRAPH:1]La caduta dell'impero romano, ed il che riuscindo età oscura ha portato l'instabilità a Europa occidentale ed un collasso prossimo del network di mestiere. Tuttavia del mestiere è accaduto. Il Radhanites erano una corporazione medievale di commercianti Ebrei che ha consentito il mestiere tra i cristiani in europa ed i Musulmani del si avvicina all'est. [PARAGRAPH:1]Dal secolo 8 ai secoli di secolo 11, il Vikings e Varangians hanno commerciato come hanno navigato da ed a Scandinavia. Il Vikings ha navigato a Europa Occidentale, mentre Varangians a Russia. La Lega di Hanseatic era un'alleanza di città commerciali che ha mantenuto un monopolio di mestiere sopra la maggior parte di Europa del nord ed il Baltico, tra i secoli 13 e 17. [PARAGRAPH:1]Le favole di viaggi del Polo di Marco all'estremo oriente hanno acceso un interesse nel mestiere di spice. Gama di da di Vasco ha cominciato il mestiere di Spice in 1498. Il mestiere di spice era di maggiore importanza economica e lo sperone aiutato l'Età di Esplorazione. Lo Spices ha portato a Europa dalle terre distanti erano alcuni delle merci più di valore per il loro peso, il loro a volte oro di rivaling. [PARAGRAPH:1]Nel secolo 16, Olanda era il centro di libero commercio, imponendo nessuni controlli di scambio, e difendere il movimento libero di merci. [PARAGRAPH:1]Commerciare nell'Indie Orientale è stato dominato da Portogallo nel secolo 16, Paesi Bassi nel secolo 17, e gli inglesi nel secolo 18.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El comercio provino con el principio de comunicación en tiempos prehistóricos. El comercio era la instalación principal de la gente prehistórica, que cambió bienes y servicios el uno del otro. Peter Watson data la historia del comercio de fondo de hacia hace 150,000 años. [PARAGRAPH:1]Se cree que el comercio ha ocurrido en todas partes de la mayor parte de la historia humana registrada. Hay pruebas del cambio de obsidiana y sílex durante la Edad de Piedra. Los materiales usados para crear joyería fueron cambiados con Egipto desde 3000 BCE los Fenicios fueron notados comerciantes de mar, que viajan a través del Mar Mediterráneo, y como el norte lejano como Gran Bretaña para fuentes de lata para fabricar el bronce. Para este fin ellos establecieron colonias comerciales los griegos llamados emporios. [PARAGRAPH:1]A partir del principio de la civilización griega hasta la caída del Imperio romano en el 5o siglo, un comercio económicamente lucrativo trajo la especia valiosa a Europa del oriente lejano, incluso China. El comercio romano permitió que su Imperio prosperara y durara. Su Imperio extendido produjo una red de transporte estable y segura que permitió el envío de bienes comerciales sin el miedo de la piratería significativa. [PARAGRAPH:1]La caída del Imperio romano, y la Alta Edad Media sucesiva trajo la inestabilidad a Europa occidental y un cerca del colapso de la red comercial. Sin embargo un poco de comercio ocurrió realmente. Los Radhanites eran un gremio medieval de comerciantes judíos que permitieron el comercio entre los Cristianos en Europa y los Musulmanes del Oriente Próximo. [PARAGRAPH:1]Del 8o siglo a los siglos del 11o siglo, los Vikingos y Varangians cambiado cuando ellos fueron en barco de y a Escandinavia. Los vikingos fueron en barco a Europa Occidental, mientras Varangians a Rusia. La Liga Hanseatic era una alianza de ciudades comerciales que mantuvieron un monopolio comercial sobre la mayor parte de Europa del Norte y el Báltico, entre los 13os y 17os siglos. [PARAGRAPH:1]Los cuentos de los viajes de Marco Polo al oriente lejano provocaron un interés al comercio de especia. Vasco da Gama comenzó el comercio de Especia en 1498. El comercio de especia tuvo la importancia económica principal y ayudó a espolear la Edad de Exploración. Las especias traídas a Europa de tierras distantes eran algunas materias más valiosas para su peso, a veces rivalizando con el oro. [PARAGRAPH:1]En el 16o siglo, Holanda era el centro de cambio libre, no imponiendo ningunos controles de divisas, y abogando por el movimiento libre de bienes. [PARAGRAPH:1]El comercio en Indies del este fue dominado por Portugal en el 16o siglo, los Países Bajos en el 17o siglo, y el Británico en el 18o siglo.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The war elephant was first used in India and was known to the Persians by the 4th Century BC. Using war elephants, Candra Gupta defeated Alexander's successor Seleucus and established the Mauryan Empire. Though Carthage's African war elephants accomplished little subsequently, their presence in Hannibal's army during his transit of the Alps into the heart of Rome in 218 BC established their reputation as a fearsome weapon. The elephant's tactical importance apparently stemmed in large part from its willingness to charge both foot soldiers and cavalry and from the panic that it inspired. Although used in Indian military forces until the 20th Century, as with so many traditional weapons, the utility of elephants in war ended with the widespread use of gunpowder.
TEXT.French: [TAB]L'utilisation des éléphants pour la guerre a commencé en Inde et était connue des Perses au IVe siècle av. J.-C. C'est grâce à ses éléphants de guerre que Chandragupta parvint à vaincre Seleucos, le successeur d'Alexandre le Grand, et à fonder l'Empire maurya. Même si les éléphants africains de Carthage ont peu d'exploits à leur actif, leur présence dans l'armée d'Hannibal lors de la traversée des Alpes en 218 av. J.-C. leur a valu une réputation d'arme redoutable. L'importance tactique des éléphants repose beaucoup sur leur capacité à attaquer l'infanterie comme la cavalerie, et à inspirer la terreur. Bien que les armées indiennes aient utilisé l'éléphant jusqu'au XXe siècle, son utilité dans la pratique de la guerre a pris fin avec l'invention de la poudre à canon.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Kriegselefant wurde zuerst in Indien eingesetzt und war den Persern im 4. Jahrhundert vor Christus schon geläufig. Mit Hilfe von Kriegselefanten gelang es dem indischen König Chandragupta, die Truppen von Seleukos, dem Nachfolger Alexanders des Großen, zu besiegen und das Maurya-Reich zu begründen. Auch wenn die afrikanischen Kriegselefanten der Karthager nur wenig ausrichten konnten, so machten sie ihrem Ruf als gefürchtetes Kriegsgerät alle Ehre, als Hannibal seine Truppen mitsamt den Dickhäutern über die Alpen führte, um im Jahre 218 vor Christus in Rom einzufallen. Die taktische Bedeutung der Kriegselefanten resultiert zum großen Teil aus ihrer Eigenschaft, sowohl Fußsoldaten als auch die Kavallerie anzugreifen und in Panik zu versetzen. Das indische Militär setzte sie zwar noch bis zum 20. Jahrhundert aktiv ein, letztlich erging es ihnen am Ende aber wie vielen anderen traditionellen "Waffen": Ihr militärischer Nutzen endete mit dem verbreiteten Einsatz von Schießpulver.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]L'elefante da guerra fu usato per la prima volta in India e fu conosciuto dai Persiani intorno al quarto secolo a. C. Grazie a queste unità, Candra Gupta sconfisse il successore di Alessandro, Seleuco, e fondò l'Impero Maurya. Anche se gli elefanti da guerra africani di Cartagine non furono determinanti, la loro presenza nell'esercito di Annibale durante la sua traversata delle Alpi verso il cuore di Roma, nel 218 a. C., affermò la loro reputazione di arma temibile. Apparentemente, l'importanza tattica dell'elefante si basa in gran parte sulla sua predisposizione a caricare sia i fanti che la cavalleria, nonché sul panico che è in grado di suscitare. Malgrado sia stato usato nelle truppe indiane fino al XX secolo, alla pari di molte armi tradizionali, la sua utilità in guerra è cessata con la diffusione della polvere da sparo.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Los elefantes de guerra fueron utilizados por primera vez en la India, y los persas ya lo conocían hacia el siglo IV a. C. Utilizando elefantes de guerra, Chandragupta derrotó a Seleuco, sucesor de Alejandro, y fundó el imperio mauryan. Aunque estos animales no sirvieron de mucho a Cartago, su presencia en el ejército de Aníbal durante el cruce de los Alpes y la invasión de Roma en el año 218 a. C. bastó para cimentar su reputación como armas terribles. La importancia táctica de los elefantes derivaba aparentemente de su disposición a cargar tanto contra la infantería como contra la caballería, y del pánico que esto inspiraba. Aunque sirvieron en el ejército indio hasta el siglo XX, su utilidad real, al igual que ocurrió con muchas otras armas tradicionales, terminó con la difusión generalizada de la pólvora.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The original crusaders were known by various terms, including fideles Sancti Petri (the faithful of Saint Peter) or milites Christi (knights of Christ). They saw themselves as undertaking a journey, or a pilgrimage, though pilgrims were usually forbidden from carrying arms. Like pilgrims, each crusader swore a vow, to be fulfilled on successfully reaching Jerusalem, and they were granted a cloth cross (crux) to be sewn into their clothes. This "taking of the cross", the crux, eventually became associated with the entire journey; the word "crusade" (coming into English from the French croisade, the Italian crociata, the Portuguese cruzada, or the German Kreuzzug) developed from this.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Aegis weapon system is an advanced combat, control, and information system that uses powerful computers and radars to track and destroy enemy targets. It is the most advanced modern combat system and is the first fully integrated combat system built to defend against air, surface, and subsurface threats. [PARAGRAPH:2]The Aegis Weapons System comprises the SPY-1 Radar, MK 99 Fire Control System and ORTS, MK 41 VLS, the Command and Decision Suite, and SM-2 Standard Missile systems. Shipboard torpedo and naval gunnery systems are also integrated. The Aegis combat system is controlled by an advanced, automatic detect-and-track, multi-function three-dimensional passive electronically scanned array radar, the AN/SPY-1. Known as "the Shield of the Fleet", the SPY high-powered (four megawatt) radar is able to perform search, tracking, and missile guidance functions simultaneously with a track capacity of well over 100 targets at more than 100 nautical miles (190 km).

TEXT.English: [TAB]The word "fighter" was first used to describe a two seater aircraft, with sufficient lift to carry a machine gun and its operator as well as the pilot. The first such "fighters" belonged to the "gunbus" series of experimental gun carriers of the British Vickers company which culminated in the Vickers F.B.5 Gunbus of 1914. The main drawback of this type of aircraft was its lack of speed. It was quickly realised that an aircraft intended to destroy its kind in the air needed at least to be fast enough to catch its quarry. [PARAGRAPH:1]Fortunately another type of military aircraft already existed, which was to form the basis for an effective "fighter" in the modern sense of the word. It was based on the small fast aircraft developed before the war for such air races as the Gordon Bennett and Schneider trophies. The military scout aeroplane was not initially expected to be able to carry serious armament, but to rely on its speed to be able to reach the location it was required to "scout" or reconnoitre and return quickly to report all the time making a difficult target for AA artillery or enemy gun-carrying aircraft. British "scout" aircraft in this sense included the Sopwith Tabloid and Bristol Scout French equivalents included the light, fast Morane-Saulnier N. [PARAGRAPH:1]Hanz Schneider had patented a device before the war to interrupt the machine gun's stream of bullets (by preventing it from firing when the propeller's blade was in the way) before the war and Anthony Fokker developed this into the Interrupter gear that would make the Fokker Eindecker such a feared name over the Western Front despite it being an adaptation of an obsolete pre-war French Morane-Saulnier racing monoplane. Simultaneously, Roland Garros (the first French 'Flying ace') was also working on a Interrupter gear, which attempted to time the firing of the individual rounds similarly when the propellor wasn't in the way. Unfortunately his choice of machine gun was poor - the gas operated Hotchkiss wasn't predictable enough to be able to time the firing and as a desperation measure he fitted metal wedges to protect the propeller's blades. At the same time the RNAS was taping up the blades on its scouts so that any rounds that damaged the prop wouldn't cause it to fail before the aircraft could be landed, with the fabric from the tape hopefully holding the blade together.

Simultaneously, Roland Garros (the first French 'Flying ace') was also working on a Interrupter gear, which attempted to time the firing of the individual rounds similarly when the propellor wasn't in the way. Unfortunately his choice of machine gun was poor - the gas operated Hotchkiss wasn't predictable enough to be able to time the firing and as a desperation measure he fitted metal wedges to protect the propeller's blades. At the same time the RNAS was taping up the blades on its scouts so that any rounds that damaged the prop wouldn't cause it to fail before the aircraft could be landed, with the fabric from the tape hopefully holding the blade together.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Chinese first to use gunpowder effectively in combat, and these primitive cannons were the result.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les Chinois sont les premiers à utiliser la poudre à canon de manière efficace au combat, ce qui donne naissance à ces canons rudimentaires.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die primitiven chinesischen Kanonen waren die ersten Schießpulver-Einheiten, die erfolgreich im Gefecht eingesetzt wurden.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]I Cinesi furono i primi a usare efficacemente la polvere da sparo in battaglia, come testimoniano questi primitivi cannoni.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Los chinos fueron los primeros en usar de forma efectiva pólvora en la guerra, y estos primitivos cañones fueron el resultado.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The bazooka is a man-portable anti-armor rocket launcher, made famous during World War II, where it was one of the primary infantry anti-tank weapons used by the United States Armed Forces. It was one of the first weapons based on the High explosive anti-tank (HEAT) shell to enter service. It was nicknamed "bazooka" from a vague resemblance to the musical instrument of the same name invented and used by Bob Burns. It saw widespread use throughout WWII.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A grenadier (French for "Grenademan") was originally a specialized assault soldier for siege operations, first established as a distinct role in the mid to late 17th century. Grenadiers were soldiers who would throw grenades and storm breaches, leading the forefront of such a breakthrough. [PARAGRAPH:1]In modern times, regiments using the name grenadiers are effectively indistinguishable from other infantry, especially when hand grenades, RPGs, and other types of explosive arms have become standard-issue weaponry; however, such regiments retain at least the tradition of their elite past. Grenadier can also refer to soldiers utilizing grenade launchers, including those mounted on rifles. During World War I a proposal to designate specialist grenade launching units in the British Army as grenadiers was vetoed by the Grenadier Guards who considered that they now had exclusive rights to the ancient distinction, and the term Bomber was substituted. [PARAGRAPH:1]In the Swiss Army, the Grenadiers form the elite Special Forces. They are used for especially challenging operations and are initially trained in Isone, a secluded, mountainous region in the South of Switzerland. The Swiss Grenadiers specialize in urban warfare, guerrilla warfare, anti-terrorist operations, commando tactics, sniper missions, hand to hand combat, and other special operations. [PARAGRAPH:1]In the Vietnam War U.S squads usually had at least one soldier whose role was that of a grenadier. He was usually armed with an M79 grenade launcher, although towards the end of the war it was replaced with an XM148 grenade launcher underslinging an M16 rifle. In infantry squads the grenadier was dedicated to his weapon, meaning that he usually carried only the M79 and a Colt 1911 side arm. In some cases, grenadiers were not even issued this sidearm. The M79 was designed to bridge the gap between the maximum throwing range of a grenade and the minimum distance of mortar fire. It also allowed the use of various rounds, notably High Explosive, buckshot, Flechette, smoke grenades and Parachute Flares. Modern US squads have continued the concept of the grenadier armed with an M203 grenade launcher attached to an M16.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Tanks were first manufactured during World War I in an effort to break the deadlock of trench warfare. The British Army realized that they required a vehicle that had the mobility to reach the enemy trenches over barbed wire and rough terrain, the armour to withstand small arms fire and shrapnel from artillery and the weaponry to suppress or destroy enemy infantry, machine gun nests and pillboxes.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Chevaliers are medieval knights who follow the code of knightly conduct. The particulars of the code varied, but codes would emphasize the virtues of courage, honor, and service. They were adept at the art of war, trained in fighting in armor, with horses, lances, swords and shields. Chevaliers were taught to excel in the arms, to show courage, to be gallant, loyal and to swear off cowardice and baseness.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The M998 High Mobility Multipurpose Wheeled Vehicle (HMMWV or Humvee) is a military 4WD motor vehicle. There are at least 17 variants of the HMMWV in service with the United States armed forces. HMMWV serve as cargo/troop carriers, automatic weapons platforms, ambulances (four litter patients or eight ambulatory patients), M220 TOW missile carriers, M119 howitzer prime movers, M-1097 Avenger Pedestal Mounted Stinger platforms, MRQ-12 direct air support vehicles, S250 shelter carriers, and in other roles. It is capable of fording 2.5 ft (76 cm) normally, or 5 ft (1.5 m) with the deep-water fording kits installed.

TEXT.English: [TAB]At the beginning of the twentieth century a number of military armored vehicles were manufactured by adding armor and weapons to existing vehicles. Most of the early designs were a large car chassis to which a body made of steel plates had been added such as the Rolls-Royce Armoured Car. [PARAGRAPH:1]A military armored car is a type of armoured fighting vehicle having wheels (from four to ten large off-road wheels) instead of tracks, and usually light armor. Armored cars are typically less expensive and have superior speed and range compared to tracked military vehicles. Most are not intended for heavy fighting; their normal use is for reconnaissance, command, control, and communications, or for use against lightly armed insurgents or rioters. Only some are intended to enter close combat, often accompanying convoys to protect soft-skinned vehicles. They usually mount a machine gun, autocannon, or small tank gun. Other uses include as a way to move (or tow) various long-range rocket, missile, or mortar batteries through dangerous areas while giving some protection to the crew.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The rise in the use of semi-automatic and automatic firearms in the late 19th and early 20th century led to the demise of horse-mounted cavalry. As a result, attackers lost a significant advantage in both scouting and deployment. It was only with the development of tanks, armored mobile attack vehicles equipped with high caliber-guns, that a weapon was found which could once more punch a hole through enemy field forces. First appearing in World War I, armored attack vehicles move quickly and strike with power, while still possessing an effective defensive strength. Tanks are powerful weapon against any ground unit.
TEXT.French: [TAB]L'utilisation croissante des armes automatiques et semi-automatiques à la fin du XIXe et au début du XXe siècle, sonna le glas de la cavalerie à cheval. De ce fait, les troupes offensives perdirent un atout important, que ce soit pour la reconnaissance ou pour l'attaque. Ce n'est qu'avec l'apparition des chars d'assaut, lors de la Première Guerre mondiale, que les armées disposèrent à nouveau d'une arme capable de percer en force les lignes ennemies. Les chars d'assaut sont des véhicules d'attaque blindés équipés de canons à gros calibre. Ils sont capables de se déplacer rapidement, disposent d'une puissance de feu importante et sont efficacement protégés par leur blindage. Les chars d'assaut sont particulièrement redoutables contre les troupes d'infanterie.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der im späten 19. und frühen 20. Jahrhundert weltweit vermehrte Einsatz halbautomatischer und automatischer Waffen besiegelte das Ende der Kavallerie und Angreifer verloren dadurch ihre bisherigen Vorzüge bei Erkundungs- und Angriffsfeldzügen. Erst mit der Entwicklung von Panzern bzw. gepanzerten mobilen Angriffsfahrzeugen, die mit hochkalibrigen Geschützen ausgestattet waren, war es wieder möglich geworden, durch die feindlichen Bodentruppen vorzustoßen. Erstmalig traten gepanzerte Angriffsfahrzeuge im 1. Weltkrieg in Aktion. Während sie sich schnell fortbewegen und mit verheerender Schlagkraft angreifen konnten, wiesen sie gleichzeitig eine wirksame Defensivstärke auf. Panzer sind eine mächtige Waffe gegen jede feindliche Bodeneinheit.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il maggiore uso delle armi da fuoco automatiche e semiautomatiche nel tardo XIX secolo e all'inizio del XX secolo portò alla fine della cavalleria. Di conseguenza, gli attaccanti persero un vantaggio significativo sia dal punto di vista dell'esplorazione che nello spiegamento. Fu solo con lo sviluppo dei carri armati, veicoli d'attacco corazzati dotati di cannoni di grosso calibro, che venne trovata un'arma che potesse nuovamente aprire una breccia nelle truppe nemiche. Apparsi per la prima volta nella Prima Guerra Mondiale, i veicoli d'attacco corazzato si muovevano rapidamente e attaccavano con efficacia, riuscendo nel contempo a difendersi validamente. I carri armati sono potenti armi contro qualsiasi tipo di unità di terra.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El triunfo de las armas de fuego automáticas y semiautomáticas, a finales del XIX y principios del XX, provocó el declive de la caballería. Como consecuencia, los atacantes perdieron una ventaja significativa en la exploración y el despliegue de tropas. Hasta la aparición de los tanques, vehículos blindados de ataque equipados con cañones de gran calibre, no volvió a verse un arma capaz de abrir una brecha en las líneas enemigas. Los vehículos ofensivos blindados, dotados de gran movilidad sin menoscabo de su capacidad defensiva, aparecieron por primera vez en la Primera Guerra Mundial. Los tanques son armas poderosas contra cualquier unidad de tierra.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Modern infantry is given the challenging task of taking and holding terrain, which often involves dangerous,close range fighting. Organized into small squads, their strength lies in their training and equipment (rifle, grenades, helmet, and other critical gear). Often individuals in the squad are trained to be specialists, allowing them access to anti-tank weapons or light machine guns. Experienced in concealment and patrolling close to the enemy, these hard-fighting men play an important and versatile role in modern military conflict.
TEXT.French: [TAB]L'infanterie moderne a pour tâche de prendre et d'occuper le terrain, ce qui implique souvent de mener de dangereux combats rapprochés. Organisée en petites escouades, sa force repose sur l'entraînement et l'équipement des soldats (fusil, grenades, casques...). Au sein d'une escouade, les soldats sont souvent spécialisés, notamment dans le maniement d'armes (armes antichars, mitrailleuses légères). Ces soldats, spécialistes de la dissimulation et du combat rapproché, jouent un rôle important dans la guerre moderne.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Aufgabe der modernen Infanterie ist vor allem die Eroberung und Sicherung des eigenen Territoriums, wobei es häufig zu gefährlichen Nahkampfgefechten kommen kann. Die Infanteristen sind in kleine Einsatztrupps eingeteilt, die sich vor allem durch ihre Ausbildung und Ausrüstung (Gewehre, Granaten, Helme sowie anderes hilfreiches Gerät) auszeichnen. Oft haben einzelne Mitglieder dieser Trupps eine Spezialausbildung absolviert, durch die sie dazu befähigt sind, Panzerabwehrwaffen oder leichte Maschinengewehre zu bedienen. Wegen ihrer umfangreichen Erfahrung im Hinblick auf die erfolgreiche Täuschung feindlicher Einheiten und das Patrouillieren in deren unmittelbarer Nähe nehmen diese versierten Kämpfer in modernen Militärkonflikten eine wichtige und vielseitige Rolle ein.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La fanteria moderna deve assolvere il difficile compito di conquistare il terreno e mantenere la posizione, manovra che spesso implica pericolosi combattimenti a distanza ravvicinata. Organizzata in piccole squadre, la forza della fanteria risiede nel suo addestramento e nel suo equipaggiamento (fucile, granate, elmetto e altri strumenti fondamentali). Spesso, alcuni individui ricevono un addestramento specialistico in modo da imparare a usare armi anticarro o mitragliatrici leggere. Esperti nel nascondersi e nell'effettuare un pattugliamento vicino al nemico, questi intrepidi uomini ricoprono un ruolo importante e versatile nei conflitti militari moderni.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La infantería moderna tiene asignada la complicada tarea de conquistar y defender el terreno, lo que significa que a menudo se ve envuelta en peligrosos combates cuerpo a cuerpo. Organizada en pequeños pelotones, su fuerza reside en su instrucción y equipamiento (fusil, granadas, casco y otros elementos de gran importancia). A menudo, en el seno de un pelotón hay especialistas, entrenados en el uso de armas anti-tanque o ametralladoras ligeras. Expertos en camuflaje y en operar cerca de las líneas enemigas, estas aguerridas unidades desempeñan un papel importante y versátil en la guerra moderna.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A nuclear submarine is a ship powered by atomic energy that travels primarily underwater, but also on the surface of the ocean. Previously, conventional submarines used diesel engines that required air for moving on the surface of the water, and battery-powered electric motors for moving beneath it. The limited lifetime of electric batteries meant that even the most advanced conventional submarine could only remained submerged for a few days at slow speed, and only a few hours at top speed. On the other hand, nuclear submarines consume a relatively small amount of fuel. Because they carry their energy source with them, current generations of nuclear submarines will never need to be refuelled throughout their 25-year lifespans, meaning they can sail around the world 40 times without surfacing. This ability, combined with advanced weapons technology, makes nuclear submarines one of the most useful warships ever built.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Stealth submarine features diesel propulsion and an additional air-independent propulsion (AIP) system using proton exchange membrane (PEM) hydrogen fuel cells. The submarine can operate at high speed on diesel power or switch to the AIP system for silent slow cruising, staying submerged for up to three weeks without surfacing and with no exhaust heat. The system is also said to be vibration-free, extremely quiet and virtually undetectable.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The guerrilla army uses ambush (draw enemy forces to terrain unsuited to them) and mobility (advantage and surprise) in attacking vulnerable targets in enemy territory.

TEXT.English: [TAB]An aircraft carrier is a warship designed to deploy and recover aircraft, acting as a sea-going airbase. Aircraft carriers thus allow a naval force to project air power great distances without having to depend on local bases for staging aircraft operations. They have evolved from wooden vessels used to deploy a balloon into nuclear powered warships that carry dozens of fixed and rotary wing aircraft. [PARAGRAPH:1]The US Navy built the first aircraft carrier to be powered by nuclear reactors. USS Enterprise is powered by eight nuclear reactors and was the second surface warship (after USS Long Beach) to be powered in this way. Subsequent supercarriers starting with USS Nimitz took advantage of this technology to increase their endurance utilizing only two reactors. The only other nation to have followed the US lead is France with Charles de Gaulle although nuclear power is used for submarine propulsion by France, Great Britain, China and the former Soviet Union.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The A-10 Thunderbolt II is an American single-seat, twin-engine jet aircraft developed by Fairchild-Republic for the United States Air Force to provide close air support (CAS) of ground forces by attacking tanks, armored vehicles, and other ground targets, also providing a limited air interdiction role. It is the first U.S. Air Force aircraft designed exclusively for close air support. [PARAGRAPH:1]The A-10 has superior maneuverability at low speeds and altitude, thanks to straight, wide wings with downturned "droop" wing tips. These also allow short takeoffs and landings, permitting operations from rugged, forward airfields near front lines. The aircraft can loiter for extended periods of time and operate under 1,000 feet (300 m) ceilings with 1.5-mile (2.4 km) visibility. It typically flies at a relatively slow speed of 300 knots (345 mph or 555 km/h), which makes it a much better candidate for the ground-attack role than fast fighter-bombers, which often have difficulty targeting small and slow-moving targets.[PARAGRAPH:1]The A-10 is exceptionally hardy, to the point that some service men refer to it as 'an airborne tank.' Its strong airframe can survive direct hits from armor-piercing and high-explosive projectiles up to 23 mm. The aircraft has triple redundancy in its flight systems, with mechanical systems to back up double-redundant hydraulic systems. This permits pilots to fly and land when hydraulic power or part of a wing is lost. Flight without hydraulic power uses the manual reversion flight control system; this engages automatically for pitch and yaw control, and under pilot control (manual reversion switch) for roll control. In manual reversion mode, the A-10 is sufficiently controllable under favorable conditions to return to base and land, though control forces are much higher than normal. The aircraft is designed to fly with one engine, one tail, one elevator and half a wing torn off.[PARAGRAPH:1]Although the A-10 can carry a considerable weight of disposable stores, its primary built-in weapon is the 30 mm GAU-8/A Avenger Gatling gun. One of the most powerful aircraft cannons ever flown, it fires large depleted uranium armor-piercing shells. In the original design, the rate of fire was selectable, 2,100 rounds per minute in the low setting, or 4,200 in the high setting. Later this was changed to a fixed rate of 3,900 rounds per minute. Another commonly used weapon is the AGM-65 Maverick air-to-surface missile, with different variations for either electro-optical (TV-guided) or infra-red targeting. The Maverick allows targets to be engaged at much greater ranges than the cannon, a safer proposition in the face of modern anti-aircraft systems. Other weapons include cluster bombs and Hydra rocket pods.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The F-117 Nighthawk is a stealth ground attack aircraft formerly operated by the United States Air Force. The F-117A's first flight was in 1981, and it achieved Initial Operational Capability status in October 1983. he F-117A came out of secrecy and was revealed to the world in November 1988. The F-117A is equipped with sophisticated navigation and attack systems integrated into a digital avionics suite. It carries no radar, which lowers emissions and cross-section. It navigates primarily by GPS and high-accuracy inertial navigation. Missions are coordinated by an automated planning system that can automatically perform all aspects of a strike mission, including weapons release. Targets are acquired by a thermal imaging infrared system, slaved to a laser that finds the range and designates targets for laser-guided bombs.

TEXT.English: [TAB]F-15 Eagle is an all-weather tactical fighter designed to gain and maintain air superiority in aerial combat. The F-15's maneuverability is derived from low wing loading (weight to wing area ratio) with a high thrust-to-weight ratio enabling the aircraft to turn tightly without losing airspeed. The F-15 can climb to 30,000 feet (10,000 m) in around 60 seconds. The thrust output of the dual engines is greater than the aircraft's weight, thus giving it the ability to accelerate in a vertical climb. The weapons and flight control systems are designed so that one person can safely and effectively perform air-to-air combat. [PARAGRAPH:1]The F-15's versatile APG-63/70 Pulse-Doppler radar system can look up at high-flying targets and down at low-flying targets without being confused by ground clutter. It can detect and track aircraft and small high-speed targets at distances beyond visual range (the maximum being 120 nautical miles (220 km) away) down to close range, and at altitudes down to treetop level. The radar feeds target information into the central computer for effective weapons delivery. The capability of locking onto targets as far as 50 nautical miles (90 km) with an AIM-120 AMRAAM enables true beyond visual range (BVR) engagement of targets. For close-in dogfights, the radar automatically acquires enemy aircraft, and this information is projected on the head-up display. The F-15's electronic warfare system provides both threat warning and automatic countermeasures against selected threats. [PARAGRAPH:1]The Eagle can be armed with combinations of four different air-to-air weapons: AIM-7F/M Sparrow missiles or AIM-120 AMRAAM advanced medium range air-to-air missiles on its lower fuselage corners, AIM-9L/M Sidewinder or AIM-120 missiles on two pylons under the wings, and an internal M61A-1 20 mm Gatling gun in the right wing root.
TEXT.French: [TAB]F-15 Eagle is an all-weather tactical fighter designed to gain and maintain air superiority in aerial combat. The F-15's maneuverability is derived from low wing loading (weight to wing area ratio) with a high thrust-to-weight ratio enabling the aircraft to turn tightly without losing airspeed. The F-15 can climb to 30,000 feet (10,000 m) in around 60 seconds. The thrust output of the dual engines is greater than the aircraft's weight, thus giving it the ability to accelerate in a vertical climb. The weapons and flight control systems are designed so that one person can safely and effectively perform air-to-air combat. [PARAGRAPH:1]The F-15's versatile APG-63/70 Pulse-Doppler radar system can look up at high-flying targets and down at low-flying targets without being confused by ground clutter. It can detect and track aircraft and small high-speed targets at distances beyond visual range (the maximum being 120 nautical miles (220 km) away) down to close range, and at altitudes down to treetop level. The radar feeds target information into the central computer for effective weapons delivery. The capability of locking onto targets as far as 50 nautical miles (90 km) with an AIM-120 AMRAAM enables true beyond visual range (BVR) engagement of targets. For close-in dogfights, the radar automatically acquires enemy aircraft, and this information is projected on the head-up display. The F-15's electronic warfare system provides both threat warning and automatic countermeasures against selected threats. [PARAGRAPH:1]The Eagle can be armed with combinations of four different air-to-air weapons: AIM-7F/M Sparrow missiles or AIM-120 AMRAAM advanced medium range air-to-air missiles on its lower fuselage corners, AIM-9L/M Sidewinder or AIM-120 missiles on two pylons under the wings, and an internal M61A-1 20 mm Gatling gun in the right wing root.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Police officers performing riot control will often wear protective riotsquad helmets and carry riot shields. These are designed to protect the wearer from those dangers that do not come from direct melee, such as hurled objects. To provide even greater protection, the protective equipment is sometimes bullet-resistant. The front-line officers in a riot control are often fully armoured and carry weapons such as batons, designed to be in direct contact with the crowd. These officers use force and intimidation to subdue rioters and subsequently allow less heavily armoured, more mobile officers to arrest people. In face of a greater threat, the riot police will be backed up with other officers equipped with riot guns to fire tear gas, rubber bullets, plastic bullets or beanbag rounds.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A man of war (also man-of-war, man'o'war or simply man) is an armed naval vessel. The term often refers to a ship armed with cannon and propelled primarily by sails, as opposed to a galley, which is propelled primarily by oars. The man of war was developed in the Mediterranean in the 15th century from earlier roundships with the addition of a second mast to form the carrack. The 16th century saw the carrack evolve into the galleon and then the ship of the line. The man'o'war (or men-o'-war) were some of the most powerful ships from the 16th19th centuries. They were developed in England in the mid-16th century by Henry VIII.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Artillery is a general term covering several varieties of large-caliber weapons including mortars and field guns. Mortars fire an explosive projectile in a high arc, and are particularly effective against small, concealed targets. Field guns, long-range weapons that fire their projectiles in a flat arc, are used primarily for their ability to penetrate hard targets. Powerful enough to batter opposing forces even behind the strongest fortifications, artillery is also able to move quickly from one firing position to another. This is an important capability when fighting a moving battle or when avoiding enemy fire.
TEXT.French: [TAB]"Artillerie" est un terme générique qui recouvre différents types d'armes de gros calibre, dont les mortiers ou les canons de campagne. Les mortiers envoient des projectiles explosifs par un tir courbe et sont particulièrement efficaces contre de petites cibles dissimulées. Les canons de campagne sont des armes à longue portée qui tirent à plat et sont particulièrement efficaces contre les cibles solides. Suffisamment puissante pour réduire des troupes ennemies, même protégées par des fortifications, l'artillerie est aussi capable de se déplacer rapidement d'une position à une autre. Cette caractéristique est particulièrement importante dans les batailles de mouvement, ou pour éviter les tirs ennemis.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Der Begriff Artillerie umschreibt verschiedene Waffen großen Kalibers, einschließlich Mörsern und Feldgeschützen. Mörser feuern explosive Geschosse in hohem Bogen ab und eignen sich besonders für Angriffe auf kleine, verdeckte Ziele. Feldgeschütze sind Fernbereichswaffen, die ihre Geschosse in flachem Bogen abschießen und hauptsächlich eingesetzt werden, um solide, befestigte Ziele zu durchdringen. Die Artillerie ist nicht nur effizient genug, um selbst massiv befestigte feindliche Truppen zu beschießen, sondern kann sich darüber hinaus auch schnell von einer Abschussposition zur nächsten fortbewegen. Dies ist insbesondere dann von Vorteil, wenn es gilt, feindlichem Beschuss auszuweichen oder sich bei einer Schlacht zu bewegen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Artiglieria è un termine generico che comprende diverse categorie di armi di grosso calibro, tra cui mortai e cannoni da campo. I mortai sparano un proiettile esplosivo con traiettoria ad arco e sono particolarmente efficaci contro obiettivi piccoli e nascosti. I cannoni da campo, armi a lunga gittata che sparano proiettili ad arco piatto, vengono invece impiegati principalmente per la loro capacità di penetrare obiettivi resistenti. Abbastanza potente da colpire il nemico dietro le fortificazioni più efficaci, l'artiglieria è anche in grado di spostarsi rapidamente da una postazione di tiro a un'altra. Ciò è indispensabile per combattere una battaglia in movimento o evitare il fuoco nemico.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Artillería es un término genérico que engloba varios tipos de armas de gran calibre, entre las que se incluyen los morteros y los cañones de campaña. Los morteros disparan un proyectil explosivo con una trayectoria curva muy pronunciada y son especialmente efectivos contra objetivos pequeños y camuflados. Los cañones de campaña, armas de largo alcance que disparan sus proyectiles en línea recta, se utilizan principalmente por su capacidad de penetración contra objetivos de gran dureza. Capaz de desencadenar duros ataques contra enemigos refugiados en las fortificaciones más poderosas, la artillería cuenta con la ventaja adicional de poder trasladarse con rapidez. Ésta es una característica importante cuando se trata de una batalla de movimiento o de esquivar el fuego enemigo.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Horseman is a cavalryman armed with a javelin while scouting and with a long spear while in a battle.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The AH-64 Apache is an all-weather day-night military attack helicopter. The AH-64 is a twin-engined helicopter with four-bladed main and tail rotors. It has a crew of two which sit in tandem. The main fixed armament is a 30 mm M230 chain gun, it is also able to carry a mixture of AGM-114 Hellfire and Hydra 70 rockets on four hard points mounted on its stub-wing pylons.
