TEXT.English: [TAB]While medium and long-range missiles have been in use since the mid-twentieth century, they were never able to effectively carry biological warheads - the biological agent tended to be destroyed or too dispersed to be effective when the weapon was detonated. With the recent development of a sturdier virus (by a shadowy consortium located somewhere in the Pacific rim), biological missile weapons are now practical. [PARAGRAPH:1]Bio-missiles are banned by treaty across the planet. However, it is rumored that a number of empires are in fact stockpiling them, ready to be deployed if necessary. [PARAGRAPH:1]Though capable of being used against armies in the field, these weapons are most effective against targets in cities, where they damage the military assets and harm the civilian population as well. This has beneficial secondary effects as well - fleeing citizens might very well spread the disease to other enemy cities. [PARAGRAPH:1]The diseases are designed to be short-lived, lessening the risk of them spreading to friendly cities. However, there is always the possibility that once deployed the virus might mutate, becoming a menace to all of humanity. Thus leaders (sane ones, anyway) see these missiles as weapons of last resort.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les missiles à moyenne ou à longue portée sont utilisés depuis la moitié du vingtième siècle, mais ils n'avaient encore jamais permis l'utilisation d'ogives biologiques, puisque l'agent biologique était généralement détruit au moment de l'impact ou que sa dispersion était trop importante pour être efficace. Avec le développement d'un virus plus résistant (suite aux travaux d'un mystérieux consortium situé quelque part sur la ceinture pacifique), les missiles à ogive biologique sont aujourd'hui opérationnels. [PARAGRAPH:1]Les missiles biologiques sont interdits sur toute la surface de la planète. Toutefois, des rumeurs affirment que certains empires ont tout un arsenal prêt à être déployé en cas de besoin. [PARAGRAPH:1]Ces missiles sont bien sûr susceptibles d'être utilisés contre une armée sur le champ de bataille, mais ils sont avant tout efficaces contre les villes, où ils touchent tout autant les infrastructures militaires que les populations civiles. L'un des effets secondaires "bénéfiques" de cette méthode est la fuite des populations touchées vers d'autres villes ennemies, permettant la propagation du virus. [PARAGRAPH:1]Les maladies ainsi transmises sont conçues pour durer le moins longtemps possible, de manière à limiter les risques de propagation aux villes alliées. Toutefois, rien ne permet de prévoir les éventuelles mutations du virus, qui deviendrait alors une menace pour l'humanité tout entière. C'est pourquoi les nations considèrent ces missiles comme leur dernier recours.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Mittel- und Langstreckenraketen werden zwar bereits seit Mitte des 20. Jahrhunderts eingesetzt, dennoch waren sie nie wirklich geeignet, um biologische Sprengköpfe zu transportieren - weil sich der Wirkstoff entweder verflüchtigte oder zu weit verstreut wurde, um bei der Zündung der Waffe seine volle Wirkung entfalten zu können. Durch die jüngste Entwicklung eines widerstandsfähigeren Virus (initiiert von einem undurchsichtigen Konsortium, das sich irgendwo in den pazifischen Randgebieten versteckt hält) sind biologische Sprengköpfe jetzt jedoch auch in der Praxis einsetzbar. [PARAGRAPH:1]Obwohl biologische Sprengköpfe im Rahmen eines weltweiten Abkommens geächtet wurden, halten sich Gerüchte, dass eine Reihe von Nationen sie dennoch herstellen, lagern und, wenn nötig, auch sofort einsetzen können. [PARAGRAPH:1]Derartige Waffen können zwar auch gegen Truppen auf offenem Gelände eingesetzt werden, am besten sind sie allerdings für Angriffe auf Städte geeignet, um militärische Einrichtungen zu beschädigen und die Zivilbevölkerung zu dezimieren. Dies hat darüber hinaus noch weitere Nebeneffekte, die im Sinne des Angreifers liegen könnten - denn es ist durchaus wahrscheinlich, dass fliehende Bürger den biologischen Kampfstoff auch in andere Städte tragen. [PARAGRAPH:1]Die freigesetzten Krankheitserreger sind relativ kurzlebig, wodurch die Gefahr der Ausbreitung in befreundeten Städten begrenzt ist, dennoch bleibt stets ein Restrisiko, dass das Virus nach seiner Freisetzung mutiert und am Ende die gesamte Menschheit gefährdet. Aus diesem Grund betrachten die Staatoberhäupter der Reiche (jedenfalls die mit gesundem Menschenverstand) biologische Sprengköpfe ausschließlich als allerletzten Ausweg.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Mentre è dalla metà del ventesimo secolo che vengono usati missili a medio e lungo raggio, non sono mai stati in grado di trasportare efficacemente testate biologiche: al momento dell'esplosione l'agente biologico solitamente o veniva distrutto o si disperdeva troppo per risultare efficace. Con il recente sviluppo di un tipo più resistente di virus (a opera di una misteriosa associazione con base da qualche parte nel Pacifico), è ora possibile realizzare missili con testate biologiche. [PARAGRAPH:1]I Missili biologici sono banditi da un trattato a livello mondiale. Pare però che alcuni imperi ne stiano producendo, pronti a usarli in caso di necessità. [PARAGRAPH:1]Anche se possono essere utilizzate sul campo, contro gli eserciti, queste armi sono più efficaci contro bersagli cittadini, dove danneggiano sia le risorse militari che la popolazione civile. Ci sono anche degli effetti secondari, visto che i cittadini in fuga possono anche diffondere la malattia in altre città nemiche. [PARAGRAPH:1]Le malattie sono progettate per avere breve durata, diminuendo così il rischio che si diffondano in città amiche. C'è sempre però la possibilità che, una volta utilizzato, il virus muti diventando una minaccia per tutta l'umanità. Per questo i leader (quelli sani di mente, quantomeno) vedono questi missili come l'ultima risors
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Pese a que los misiles de largo alcance se venían usando desde mediados del s. XX, nunca fueron capaces de cargar ojivas biológicas: al detonar el arma, los agentes biológicos solían destruirse o dispersarse demasiado como para ser efectivos. Gracias al reciente desarrollo de virus más sólidos (a manos de un misterioso consorcio ubicado en alguna costa del Pacífico), los misiles biológicos ya son factibles. [PARAGRAPH:1]Los biomisiles están prohibidos en todo el planeta por un tratado internacional. Sin embargo, se rumorea que algunos imperios están haciendo acopio de ellos, listos para ser lanzados en caso de necesidad. [PARAGRAPH:1]Aunque puedan usarse contra ejércitos en el campo de batalla, dichas armas son más efectivas contra objetivos en las ciudades, donde pueden destruir tanto recursos militares como población civil. Esto también tiene efectos secundarios, ya que los ciudadanos que huyan propagarán la enfermedad a otras ciudades enemigas. [PARAGRAPH:1]Las enfermedades están diseñadas para durar poco, de modo que se reduce el peligro de propagación a ciudades amigas. Sin embargo, siempre queda la posibilidad de que, una vez utilizado, el virus pueda mutar y convertirse en una amenaza para toda la humanidad. Por ello los líderes (los cuerdos, al menos) contemplan dichos misiles como armas de último recurs

TEXT.English: [TAB]The term "Aegis cruiser" loosely describes a cruiser carrying an Aegis anti-missile system created by the United States in the late twentieth century. The US Navy had long been developing an anti-missile vessel, and the sinking of the British destroyer HMS 'Sheffield' by a single French Exocet missile during the Falklands War only increased their efforts. [PARAGRAPH:1]Aegis cruisers are typically armed with anti-missile missiles, as well as two enormous "Vulcan" gatling guns, "last ditch" weapons designed to destroy close-in missiles that evaded the cruiser's defensive missiles. The ships are also equipped with anti-aircraft weaponry and some anti-submarine defenses, as well. In addition, the cruisers often carry offensive missiles which can be deployed against naval or land-based targets. Aegis cruisers are most usually deployed as escort vessels, protecting the highly vulnerable carrier groups from missile and air assault.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le terme de "Croiseur Aegis" désigne un croiseur armé du système anti-missiles Aegis, conçu par les Etats-Unis à la fin du vingtième siècle. La marine américaine a toujours cherché à doter sa flotte de vaisseaux anti-missiles. Le torpillage du destroyer britannique HMS Sheffield par un simple missile Exocet français lors de la guerre des Malouines les incita à redoubler d'efforts. [PARAGRAPH:1]Les croiseurs Aegis sont généralement dotés de missiles anti-missiles ainsi que de deux énormes canons "Vulcain", censés pouvoir détruire les missiles qui auraient échappé à la surveillance des radars. Ces vaisseaux sont également équipés de tout un arsenal anti-aérien et anti-sous-marins. En outre, les croiseurs sont souvent pourvus de missiles d'attaque qui peuvent être déployés contre des cibles navales ou terrestres. Les croiseurs Aegis sont le plus souvent utilisés pour servir d'escorte aux transporteurs.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Als "Aegis-Kreuzer" bezeichnet man einen Ende des 20. Jahrhunderts in den Vereinigten Staaten eingesetzten Kreuzer, der mit einem Aegis-Kampfsystem ausgestattet ist. Die U.S. Navy hatte bereits lange an der Entwicklung eines Schiffes mit Warn- und Feuerleitsystem gearbeitet, als diese Bemühungen nach der Versenkung des britischen Zerstörers HMS 'Sheffield' während des Falklandkrieges durch eine einzige französische Exocet-Rakete noch stärker vorangetrieben wurden. [PARAGRAPH:1]Aegis-Kreuzer sind normalerweise mit Abfangraketen sowie zwei riesigen "Vulcan"-Gatlingkanonen ausgestattet - also Waffen, die als allerletztes Mittel eingesetzt werden, um anfliegende Raketen zu zerstören, die zuvor den Abwehrraketen des Kreuzers ausweichen konnten. Darüber hinaus sind die Schiffe mit Flugabwehrwaffen sowie einigen U-Boot-Abwehrwaffen und häufig auch mit Angriffsraketen ausgerüstet, die sowohl gegen land- als auch seegestützte Ziele eingesetzt werden können. Aegis-Kreuzer dienen in aller Regel als Begleitschiffe für äußerst angreifbare Flugzeugträgerflotten, die vor Raketen- und Luftbombardierungen geschützt werden müssen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Il termine Incrociatore Aegis descrive in genere un incrociatore con un sistema antimissili Aegis, creato nel tardo ventesimo secolo dagli Stati Uniti. La marina americana studiava da molto un vascello antimissile e l'affondamento del cacciatorpediniere britannico HMS 'Sheffield' da parte di un singolo missile francese Exocet, durante la guerra delle Falkland, non fece che far aumentare i loro sforzi. [PARAGRAPH:1]Gli incrociatori Aegis sono solitamente armati con missili antimissile, oltre che con due enormi "Vulcan", mitragliatrici gatling, che fungono da ultima speranza nel caso in cui il missile in arrivo riesca a evitare quelli difensivi. Le navi sono anche equipaggiate con armi antiaeree e alcune difese antisommergibile. In più questi incrociatori hanno spesso missili d'attacco che possono essere utilizzati contro bersagli navali o terrestri. Gli incrociatori Aegis vengono usati la maggior parte delle volte come vascelli di scorta per proteggere da attacchi aerei e missilistici le portaerei.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El término "crucero Aegis" describe en términos generales a un crucero que transporta un sistema antimisiles Aegis, creado por los Estados Unidos a finales del s. XX. La armada de los EE. UU. pasó mucho tiempo desarrollando un buque antimisiles, y el hundimiento del destructor británico HMS "Sheffield" a causa del impacto de un único misil francés Exocet durante la guerra de las Malvinas no hizo más que acrecentar sus esfuerzos. [PARAGRAPH:1]Los cruceros Aegis suelen ir armados con misiles antimisil, así como con dos enormes cañones Gatling "Vulcan", armas que se usan como último recurso para destruir misiles cercanos que han burlado a los misiles de defensa del crucero. Los buques también cuentan con armamento antiaéreo y defensas antisubmarinos. Además, dichos cruceros a menudo cuentan con misiles de ataque que pueden lanzarse contra objetivos navales o terrestres. Los cruceros Aegis acostumbran a usarse como naves de escolta para proteger a los vulnerables grupos de portaaviones de incursiones aéreas o de misiles.

TEXT.English: [TAB]While animal cloning has been around for decades, for many years all attempts to clone humans were unsuccessful. Technological advances eventually allowed scientists to "grow" human clones; however, while physically identical to "natural" humans, these unfortunate creatures seem incapable of developing any higher mental functions. The clones' organs and limbs could be harvested for replacement parts, but the clones themselves were totally useless. Until recently, that is.[PARAGRAPH:1]Recent advancements in medicine and bioengineering have allowed clones to be "jacked" into fairly sophisticated computer networks able to direct them to perform simple tasks. Clone laborers are now deployed worldwide, building roads, digging trenches, plowing fields, and so forth. While the initial outlay for the zombie-like workers is high, it's not actually much higher than the cost of feeding, clothing and educating a human worker for some eighteen years before you can put him to work. And when a clone worker wears out, you don't have to provide for its retirement: instead you can sell the creature to an organ bank for "decommissioning."
TEXT.French: [TAB]Après la mise au point du clonage d'animaux, il y a des dizaines d'années, toutes les tentatives de clonage humain se sont soldées par des échecs. Il aura fallu attendre une véritable révolution technologique pour voir des scientifiques parvenir à "faire pousser" des clones humains en laboratoires. Mais si ce clone humain était physiquement identique à son modèle, il était en revanche dépourvu de toute faculté mentale. Le clonage fut donc utilisé exclusivement dans le but de fournir des organes de substitution à la médecine. Mais là encore, les choses ont changé. [PARAGRAPH:1]Les récents progrès de la médecine et de la bio-ingénierie ont abouti à la création de systèmes très complexes permettant de programmer les clones pour des tâches rudimentaires. Ces nouveaux ouvriers sont depuis utilisés pour construire des routes, creuser des tranchées, labourer des champs, etc. L'investissement de départ est élevé mais le coût d'un clone est vite amorti, compte tenu des frais de nourriture, d'habillement et de formation d'un ouvrier humain pendant les dix-huit ans qui précèdent sa "mise en service". En outre, lorsqu'un clone ouvrier ne peut plus travailler, il ne nécessite pas de prise en charge : il suffit de le revendre à une banque d'organes pour officialiser son déclassement.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Während Tiere schon seit Jahrzehnten geklont werden, schlugen sämtliche Versuche, Menschen zu klonen, jahrelang fehl. Dank technologischer Fortschritte war die Wissenschaft schließlich aber doch noch in der Lage, menschliche Klone zu "züchten". Diese bedauernswerten Kreaturen sind zwar physisch mit "natürlichen" Menschen identisch, schienen aber keine höheren geistigen Fähigkeiten entwickeln zu können. Dementsprechend konnte man die Organe und Gliedmaßen der Klone sozusagen als "Ersatzteile" verwenden, ansonsten waren sie allerdings völlig nutzlos - bis vor kurzem.[PARAGRAPH:1]Jüngste Fortschritte auf den Gebieten der Medizin und der Biotechnologie ermöglichen heute das "Einklinken" von Klonen in ein relativ ausgefeiltes Computernetzwerk, wodurch sie einfache Aufgaben ausführen können. Mittlerweile werden solche Klonarbeiter weltweit für den Straßenbau, das Ausheben von Schützengräben, die Feldarbeit etc. eingesetzt. Die Anschaffungskosten für diese Golem-artigen Arbeiter mögen zunächst recht hoch erscheinen, andererseits übersteigen sie aber kaum die Kosten für die Verpflegung, Kleidung und Ausbildung eines Menschen bis zum 18. Lebensjahr, wenn er mit der Arbeit beginnt. Und wenn ein Klonarbeiter verschlissen ist, braucht man sich außerdem auch nicht um seinen Ruhestand zu sorgen - sondern verkauft ihn einfach zwecks "Stilllegung" an eine Organbank.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Anche se la clonazione animale esiste da decenni, per molti anni è fallito ogni tentativo di clonare gli esseri umani. I progressi tecnologici hanno infine permesso agli scienziati di "crescere" cloni umani. Pur essendo fisicamente identici agli umani "naturali", però, queste sfortunate creature sembravano incapaci di sviluppare funzioni cerebrali superiori. Era possibile raccoglierne organi e parti per i trapianti, ma i cloni in sé rimanevano completamente inutili. Fino a poco fa, comunque.[PARAGRAPH:1]I recenti progressi nella medicina e nella bioingegneria hanno fatto in modo che i cloni potessero essere "collegati" a reti di computer abbastanza sofisticati da poterli controllare nell'esecuzione di semplici compiti. I lavoratori cloni ora sono utilizzati in tutto il mondo nella costruzione di strade, nello scavo di fossati, nel lavoro dei campi e così via. Anche se il costo iniziale di un lavoratore zombi è alto, non lo è molto di più di quello complessivo per cibare, vestire ed educare un umano per diciotto anni prima di metterlo al lavoro. E quando un clone si logora non c'è bisogno di preoccuparsi della sua pensione: lo si vende a una banca di organ
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Aunque se habían clonado animales durante décadas, todos los intentos de clonar humanos fracasaron durante muchos años. Los avances tecnológicos permitieron finalmente a los científicos "criar" clones humanos. Sin embargo, aunque eran físicamente idénticos a los humanos "naturales", estas desafortunadas criaturas parecían incapaces de desarrollar cualquier función mental. Se podían "recolectar" sus órganos y miembros para transplantes, pero los clones por sí mismos eran completamente inútiles. Es decir, hasta hace poco.[PARAGRAPH:1]Los últimos avances en medicina y bioingeniería han permitido que los clones se "enchufen" a redes de ordenadores bastante sofisticadas, capaces de ordenarles la realización de tareas simples. Los obreros clonados se han desplegado por todo el mundo, construyendo carreteras, cavando zanjas, arando campos, etcétera. Aunque el desembolso inicial para los obreros cuasi zombis es alto, de hecho no representa mucho más que el coste de alimentar, vestir y educar a un obrero humano durante unos dieciocho años antes de poder ponerlo a trabajar. Y cuando un obrero clonado se agota, uno no debe preocuparse por su jubilación: en lugar de ello, puede vender a la criatura a un banco de órganos para que lo "desguace"

TEXT.English: [TAB]Developed in the mid-twenty-first century, the so-called "automatons" are soldiers, of a sort. In fact, these creatures are human clones controlled by sophisticated computers. Without the aid of controlling computers, human clones are barely sentient and totally incapable of reasoned action; clones equipped with computers are able to perform fairly effectively on the battlefield. While they are not as skilled as fully-human soldiers, automatons are also not subject to fear, and they always attempt to carry out orders, no matter how suicidal. They are also much cheaper to train and equip than their human counterparts, a factor which has become of increasing importance as wars have become more and more expensive.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Développés au milieu du vingt-et-unième siècle, les automates sont des soldats un peu particuliers. Il s'agit en fait de clones d'humains contrôlés par des programmes informatiques complexes. Sans l'aide de ces programmes, ces clones sont totalement incapables d'avoir un comportement rationnel. Les clones équipés de ces programmes sont en outre très efficaces au combat parce qu'ils ne sont pas aussi intelligents que des humains, mais ils ignorent la peur et obéissent aveuglément aux ordres, même les plus suicidaires. Enfin, le coût de formation d'un clone est absolument dérisoire, un facteur de plus en plus important dans le cadre de guerres de plus en plus onéreuses.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Mitte des 21. Jahrhunderts wurden die so genannten "Robotersoldaten" als eine Art neue militärische Einheitengattung entwickelt. Tatsächlich handelt es sich bei diesen Kreaturen um menschliche Klone, die von hoch entwickelten Computern gesteuert werden. Ohne den Einsatz der Kontrollcomputer sind die Klone vollkommen empfindungsunfähig und außerstande, logische Handlungen nachzuvollziehen. Mit diesen Computern ausgestattete Robotersoldaten lassen sich allerdings relativ wirkungsvoll auf dem Schlachtfeld einsetzen: Sie sind zwar nicht so qualifiziert wie menschliche Soldaten, kennen jedoch keinerlei Angst und führen ihre Befehle nach Möglichkeit immer bis zum Ende aus - unabhängig davon, wie selbstzerstörerisch sie auch sein mögen. Außerdem ist die Ausbildung und Ausrüstung der Roboter im Vergleich zu ihren menschlichen Kameraden deutlich preiswerter und dieser Faktor hat in der Vergangenheit stetig an Bedeutung gewonnen, da die Kriegsführung allgemein immer teurer geworden ist.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Sviluppati a metà del ventunesimo secolo, i cosiddetti "automi" sono una specie di soldati. Infatti, queste creature sono cloni umani controllati da sofisticati computer. Senza l'aiuto dei computer i cloni umani sono a malapena senzienti e totalmente incapaci di azioni ragionate, mentre i cloni equipaggiati con i computer sono in grado di operare in maniera abbastanza efficiente sul campo di battaglia. Non sono abili come i soldati umani, ma non sono soggetti alla paura e cercano sempre di eseguire gli ordini, a prescindere da quanto siano suicidi. Sono anche molto meno costosi da addestrare ed equipaggiare delle controparti umane, un fattore che ha assunto un'importanza sempre crescente, visto che le guerre si sono fatte sempre più costos
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Desarrollados a mediados del s. XXI, los llamados "autómatas" son soldados, por así decirlo. De hecho, dichas criaturas son clones humanos controlados por sofisticados ordenadores. Sin la ayuda de los ordenadores de control, apenas son conscientes o capaces de cualquier acción razonada. Los clones equipados con ordenadores son perfectamente capaces de actuar con mucha eficacia en el campo de batalla. Pese a que no son tan hábiles como los soldados completamente humanos, los autómatas no conocen el miedo y siempre están dispuestos a desempeñar cualquier orden, por suicida que sea. También son mucho más baratos de entrenar y equipar que sus equivalentes humanos, factor que ha ido adquiriendo mayor importancia a medida que las guerras se han encarecido cada vez má

TEXT.English: [TAB]The development of lightweight and efficient cold fusion generators has allowed the creation of ever-larger and more deadly land-based vehicles. The so-called "dreadnoughts" are the largest land vehicles ever built, towering over ordinary tanks like a skyscraper over a humble peasant cottage. [PARAGRAPH:1]Dreadnoughts are huge, powerful vehicles, typically equipped with one or more massive main guns and a number of smaller weapons to deal with any close-in opponents. They are heavily-armored, carrying anti-air weapons and the latest in physical and electromagnetic shielding capable of defending against the deadliest attack. It is theorized that a dreadnought could withstand a nuclear explosion, though this has not yet been put to the test. [PARAGRAPH:1]In the field dreadnoughts are usually deployed to attack enemy cities, especially well-defended arcologies cities equipped with electromagnetic shielding. These behemoths are virtually unstoppable, unless the enemy has its own dreadnoughts or is willing to sacrifice huge numbers of lesser troops in suicidal wave assaults.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Le développement de générateurs de fusion froide plus légers et plus efficaces permit la création de nouveaux véhicules de combat, plus grands et plus puissants. Ces "dreadnoughts" sont les plus grands véhicules jamais construits. A côté d'eux, les tanks ordinaires semblent minuscules. [PARAGRAPH:1]Les dreadnoughts sont des véhicules gigantesques et ultra puissants, généralement dotés d'un ou plusieurs canons principaux et de tourelles dédiées au combat rapproché. Lourdement blindés, ils sont montés de canons anti-aériens et équipés des tout derniers boucliers électromagnétiques, ce qui leur permet de résister aux attaques les plus destructrices. En théorie, un dreadnought ne peut pas survivre à une explosion nucléaire, mais aucun test n'a encore confirmé cette hypothèse. [PARAGRAPH:1]Au combat, les dreadnoughts sont généralement déployés pour attaquer les villes ennemies et tout particulièrement les arcologies dotées de boucliers électromagnétiques. Ces géants sont virtuellement impossibles à arrêter, à moins que l'ennemi ne dispose d'autres dreadnoughts ou soit prêt à envoyer de nombreuses unités au suicide.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Entwicklung kompakter, leistungsfähiger Kaltfusionsgeneratoren ermöglichte unter anderem auch die Herstellung noch stärkerer und vernichtenderer Landfahrzeuge. Der so genannte "Dreadnought" ist das größte Landfahrzeug, das je gebaut wurde: Er überragt einen herkömmlichen Panzer wie ein Wolkenkratzer eine bescheidene Bauernhütte. [PARAGRAPH:1]Dreadnoughts sind riesige, äußerst effiziente Fahrzeuge, die normalerweise mit einer oder mehreren gewaltigen Primärwaffen und einer Batterie von kleineren Nahkampfwaffen ausgerüstet sind. Sie sind massiv gepanzert, haben Luftabwehrwaffen an Bord und verfügen über modernste physische und elektromagnetische Schildtechnologie, die selbst tödlichste Attacken abwehren kann. Theoretisch könnte ein Dreadnought sogar einer atomaren Explosion standhalten, dies wurde jedoch bislang in der Praxis noch nicht erwiesen.[PARAGRAPH:1]Auf dem Schlachtfeld werden die Dreadnoughts normalerweise für Angriffe auf feindliche Städte eingesetzt, insbesondere gegen gut befestigte Arkologien, die sich mit elektromagnetischen Schilden schützen. Diese Giganten sind praktisch nicht aufzuhalten, es sei denn, der Feind verfügt über eigene Dreadnoughts oder ist bereit, in selbstzerstörerischen Angriffswellen eine enorme Anzahl unterlegener Truppen zu opfern.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Lo sviluppo di generatori per la fusione a freddo leggeri ed efficienti ha portato alla creazione di veicoli terresti ancora più grandi e letali. I cosiddetti "Dreadnought" sono i più grandi veicoli terrestri mai costruiti e torreggiano sui normali carri armati come grattacieli su villette di campagna. [PARAGRAPH:1]I Dreadnought sono veicoli enormi e potenti, solitamente equipaggiati con uno o più enormi cannoni e un numero di armi più piccole per eliminare gli avversari a corto raggio. Sono pesantemente corazzati, hanno armi antiaeree e i più recenti scudi in campo fisico ed elettromagnetico, in grado di difenderli dagli attacchi più letali. Si dice che in teoria un Dreadnought potrebbe resistere a un'esplosione nucleare, anche se tale teoria non è ancora stata messa alla prova. [PARAGRAPH:1]Sul campo i Dreadnought vengono solitamente utilizzati per attaccare le città nemiche, specialmente le arcologie ben difese e dotate di scudi elettromagnetici. Questi giganti sono virtualmente inarrestabili, a meno che il nemico non ne abbia a sua volta uno o sia disposto a sacrificare in attacchi suicidi un enorme numero di truppe meno potent
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El desarrollo de generadores de fusión fría ligeros y eficaces ha llevado a la creación de vehículos terrestres cada vez más grandes y mortales. Los llamados "dreadnoughts" son los mayores vehículos jamás construidos, pues se alzan sobre los tanques normales como un rascacielos sobre la choza de un campesino. [PARAGRAPH:1]Los dreadnoughts son vehículos enormes y potentes que suelen ir equipados con uno o más cañones principales enormes y cierto número de armas menores para hacer frente a cualquier enemigo que se acerque. Cuentan con blindaje pesado, llevan armas antiaéreas y el último grito en escudo electromagnéticos, capaces de protegerlos de los ataques más mortíferos. En teoría, un dreadnought podría resistir una explosión atómica, aunque este extremo no ha llegado a probarse. [PARAGRAPH:1]En el campo de batalla, los dreadnoughts se suelen desplegar para atacar ciudades enemigas, especialmente las arcologías, que están muy bien defendidas con escudos electromagnéticos. Estos titanes son prácticamente imparables, a menos que el enemigo cuente con sus propios dreadnoughts o esté dispuesto a sacrificar cantidades ingentes de tropas menores en sucesivas oleadas de ataques suicida

TEXT.English: [TAB]Originally created to exert control over rebellious citizens of conquered cities, the earliest mechanized assault units were designed as much to be terrifying as they were to be militarily potent. Just park one of these monsters in the center of a city - the theory went - where it would literally tower over everything else within sight, and even the staunchest citizens would rapidly lose all interest in armed rebellion. Not surprisingly, the Assault Mechs proved quite effective at this task, and it was determined to try the units in field combat. [PARAGRAPH:1]Military traditionalists have repeatedly pointed out that the Assault Mechs are very poorly designed weapons - farcically bad, some have even said. They're extremely tall and are almost impossible to camouflage, making them easy targets. Their two-legged gait is more complicated, more expensive, more vulnerable and less efficient than are treaded wheels. And if one of the blasted things fall over, it can't get up again without the assistance of massive cranes or helicopters. Yank off the legs and mount the chassis on treads, the experts say, and you'll get a better weapon at lower cost. [PARAGRAPH:1]All this is true. However, the units have one thing going for them that more than compensates for all of their weaknesses: they're massively, enormously cool. Military planners have long noted that national governments often confuse coolness with effectiveness and are willing to pay a lot more for flashy armaments than they are for effective but dull systems. In other words, a military with Mech Assault units has an easier time getting its bloated budget approved than does one without them. As long as this continues, the Mech's future is assured.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Crées dans le but de contrôler les populations hostiles des villes conquises en territoire ennemi, les unités de combat robotisées sont aussi terrifiantes qu'efficaces. Placer l'un de ces monstres au milieu d'une ville, en surplomb des gratte-ciel, suffit généralement à dissuader les dissidents les plus téméraires. Les robots de combat se révélèrent si efficaces dans leur rôle de sentinelle, qu'ils furent rapidement envoyés sur les champs de bataille. [PARAGRAPH:1]Les militaires les plus conservateurs n'ont cessé de pointer du doigt les insuffisances des robots de combat, qu'ils qualifient de gros gadgets ridicules. Ces robots sont extrêmement grands et absolument impossibles à camoufler, ce qui en fait des cibles faciles. Leur mode de déplacement sur deux jambes est assez complexe, coûteux à produire et les rend à la fois plus vulnérables et moins efficaces que des chenilles. Une fois à terre, le robot de combat ne peut pas se relever sans l'aide d'une grue ou d'hélicoptères. Tous les experts vous le diront : arrachez-lui les jambes et montez-le sur chenilles et vous obtiendrez une arme bien plus efficace pour bien moins cher. [PARAGRAPH:1]Malgré tous ces défauts, ces robots présentent un avantage qui compense toutes leurs lacunes : ils ont une allure incroyable. Les experts militaires ont bien compris que les gouvernements confondaient souvent allure et efficacité. Ils sont ainsi souvent disposés à payer plus cher un armement moins performant, mais qui leur en met plein la vue. Autrement dit, il est plus facile de faire voter un budget militaire colossal à partir du moment où la dotation comprend des Robots de combat. Et tant qu'il en sera ainsi, leur avenir sera assuré.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die ersten Angriffsroboter waren ursprünglich erschaffen worden, um die rebellische Bevölkerung eroberter Städte unter Kontrolle zu bringen. Dementsprechend sollten sie nicht nur Angst und Schrecken verbreiten können, sondern auch für militärische Zwecke einsetzbar sein. Ist auch nur eins dieser Monster im Zentrum einer Stadt stationiert - so die Theorie -, überragt es praktisch alles andere in Sichtweite, so dass selbst die hartgesottensten Revoluzzer sehr schnell ihren bewaffneten Widerstand aufgeben werden. Nachdem sich die Angriffsroboter bei der Ausführung dieser Aufgabe als ziemlich effizient erwiesen hatten, beschloss man schließlich, sie auch als Kampfeinheiten auf dem Schlachtfeld auszuprobieren. [PARAGRAPH:1]Traditionelle Militärs wiesen wiederholt darauf hin, dass die Angriffsroboter lediglich sehr schlecht konzipierte Waffen seien - manche vertraten sogar die Meinung, sie seien aus militärischer Sicht ein schlechter Witz. Wegen ihrer extremen Größe ist eine wirkungsvolle Tarnung fast unmöglich, so dass sie leicht als Ziel zu erfassen sind. Außerdem bewegen sich auf zwei Beinen fort, sind teurer, verwundbarer und weniger effizient als mit Profilreifen ausgestattete Einheiten. Und wenn eins der verdammten Dinger umfällt, kann es sich ohne Zuhilfenahme großer Kräne oder Hubschrauber nicht allein wieder aufrichten. Experten vertreten daher die Auffassung, man könne sie zu besseren und preiswerteren Waffen umrüsten, indem man die Beine abmontiert und das Chassis auf Profilreifen setzt. [PARAGRAPH:1]Das alles ist nicht von der Hand zu weisen, dennoch spricht eine Sache mehr für diese Einheit, als all ihre Schwächen gegen sie sprechen: Sie ist extrem cool. Und die Militärstrategen sind sich schon lange darüber im Klaren, dass Regierungen oftmals Coolness mit Effizienz verwechseln und daher auch bereit sind, weitaus höhere finanzielle Mittel für schrille Panzerungen zur Verfügung zu stellen als für effiziente, aber weniger eindrucksvolle Systeme. Mit anderen Worten: Sofern es über Angriffsroboter verfügt, hat es das Militär deutlich leichter, seine übersteigerten Budgetforderungen durchzusetzen, als ohne sie - und solange das so bleibt, ist die Zukunft der Roboter gesichert.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Inizialmente create per esercitare il controllo sui cittadini ribelli delle città conquistate, le prime unità meccanizzate d'assalto erano progettate per essere tanto terrificanti quanto potenti da un punto di vista militare. Bastava parcheggiare uno di questi mostri al centro di una città, diceva la teoria, dove avrebbe sovrastato tutto ciò che lo circondava, e anche i più fedeli cittadini avrebbero rapidamente perso qualsiasi interesse nella ribellione armata. I Mech d'assalto si rivelarono davvero efficaci, in questo, e venne deciso di testarli in combattimento. [PARAGRAPH:1]I tradizionalisti militari hanno sottolineato più volte come il Mech d'assalto sia un'arma progettata male, "da farsa" hanno detto alcuni. Sono estremamente alti e quasi impossibili da mimetizzare, il che li rende facili bersagli. Il loro movimento a due gambe è più complicato, costoso, vulnerabile e meno efficiente di quello su cingoli. E se uno dei dannati affari cade, non può rialzarsi senza l'aiuto di enormi gru o elicotteri. Secondo gli esperti basterebbe levare le gambe e metterci dei cingoli per avere un'arma migliore a un costo inferiore. [PARAGRAPH:1]Tutto ciò è vero. Queste unità hanno però una caratteristica che basta e avanza a compensare tutte le loro altre debolezze: sono enormemente, incredibilmente affascinanti. I progettisti militari hanno notato da molto tempo che i governi tendono a confondere il fascino con l'efficacia e sono disposti a pagare molto di più per armi appariscenti di quanto non facciano per sistemi efficaci ma noiosi. In altre parole, un esercito con un Mech d'assalto fa meno fatica a farsi approvare un budget enorme di quanta ne farebbe senza. Fino a quando ciò continuerà, esisteranno i Mec
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Creados originalmente para someter a los habitantes rebeldes de las ciudades conquistadas, las primeras unidades de asalto mecanizado ("mechs") fueron diseñadas tanto para aterrorizar como para ser potentes militarmente. La teoría decía que, con solo aparcar a uno de esos monstruos en el centro de una ciudad, donde literalmente dominaría la vista de cualquier sitio, hasta los ciudadanos más intrépidos perderían todo interés por levantarse en armas. No es de sorprender que los mechs de asalto resultasen bastante eficaces en este cometido. Así que se ha decidido probarlos en el campo de batalla. [PARAGRAPH:1]Los militares tradicionalistas han señalado repetidamente que los mechs de asalto son armas muy mal diseñadas, y alguno incluso se han atrevido a clasificarlas de absurdas. Son extremadamente altas y casi imposibles de camuflar, lo que les convierte en objetivos fáciles. Su modo de desplazamiento, bípedo, es más caro y vulnerable y menos eficaz que las orugas. Y, si uno de esos malditos cacharros se cayese, no podría levantarse sin ayuda de grúas o helicópteros enormes. Arráncale las patas y monta el chasis sobre unas orugas y tendrás un arma mejor y a un coste inferior, a decir de los expertos. [PARAGRAPH:1]Todo eso es verdad. No obstante, estas unidades tienen algo que compensa con creces todos sus puntos débiles: molan una barbaridad. Los planificadores militares hace mucho que se han dado cuenta de que los gobiernos nacionales suelen confundir la "molonería" con la eficacia y desean pagar mucho más por un armamento llamativo que por equipos más sobrios pero eficaces. En otras palabras, un ejército con mechs de asalto tiene más fácil que le aprueben un presupuesto inflado que uno que no los tenga. Mientras esto siga así, el futuro del mech está asegurad

TEXT.English: [TAB]Cyborgs are improved "automatons," clone soldiers controlled by bio-mechanical computers. Cyborgs are smarter and tougher than their primitive cousins, and while still not as intelligent or effective as "normal" human soldiers, they come pretty close. While further advancement in intelligence is theoretically possible, many political leaders are reluctant to allow the scientists to try to increase the cyborgs' mental capacity any farther, fearing that smarter organisms may decide to rebel against their creators, wreaking a terrible revenge on those who have enslaved them. Exasperated generals believe that this so-called "Battlestar Galactica" syndrome (named after an American television program from the beginning of the twenty-first century) is patent nonsense, but as of yet have not yet been able to prevail.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les cyborgs sont des automates améliorés, des clones soldats contrôlés par des programmes biomécaniques. Plus intelligents que leurs cousins primitifs, les cyborgs n'atteignent pas encore tout à fait les niveaux de raisonnement des soldats humains. Si une avancée dans ce domaine est encore théoriquement possible, de nombreux dirigeants refusent de laisser les scientifiques créer des cyborgs trop évolués mentalement, de peur qu'ils n'utilisent leurs capacités pour se rebeller contre leurs créateurs et qu'ils se vengent. Cette frilosité agace les généraux au plus haut point ; ils voient dans ce syndrome "Battlestar Galactica" (du nom d'une série télévisée américaine du début du vingt-et-unième siècle) un sérieux coup de frein à l'amélioration des techniques militaires.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Cyborgs sind verbesserte "Robotersoldaten", also Klonsoldaten, die von biomechanischen Computern gesteuert werden. Sie sind cleverer und widerstandsfähiger als ihre primitiven Artgenossen und kommen den "normalen" Soldaten, trotz ihrer geringeren Intelligenz und Leistungsfähigkeit, doch recht nahe. Theoretisch wäre es zwar möglich, sie mit einer verbesserten Intelligenz auszustatten, dennoch zögern viele politische Führer, ihren Wissenschaftlern die Genehmigung zu erteilen, die mentalen Kapazitäten der Cyborgs zu steigern, weil sie fürchten, dass sich die dann klügeren Organismen gegen ihre Schöpfer wenden und fürchterliche Rache an all jenen üben könnten, die sie unterjocht haben. Genervte Generäle halten dieses so genannte "Kampfstern Galactica"-Syndrom (benannt nach einer amerikanischen Fernsehserie des 21. Jahrhunderts) für reinen Unsinn, konnten sich aber bislang nicht dagegen durchsetzen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]I cyborg sono "automi" migliorati, cloni soldato controllati da computer biomeccanici. Sono più furbi e resistenti dei loro cugini primitivi e, anche se non sono intelligenti o efficaci come i "normali" soldati umani, ci vanno molto vicino. Pur essendo in teoria possibile un ulteriore sviluppo intellettuale, i leader politici sono riluttanti a permettere agli scienziati di tentare di aumentare ulteriormente la capacità mentale dei cyborg. Temono, infatti, che degli organismi più intelligenti possano decidere di ribellarsi ai propri creatori, vendicandosi in maniera terribile su coloro che li hanno resi schiavi. I generali, esasperati, credono che questa sindrome da "Battlestar Galactica" (che prende il nome da una serie televisiva americana dell'inizio del ventunesimo secolo) sia una stupidaggine, ma non sono ancora riusciti ad averla vint
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Los ciborgs son "autómatas" mejorados, soldados clonados que están controlados por ordenadores biomecánicos. Son más listos y duros que sus primitivos primos y, aunque no sean tan eficaces ni inteligentes como los soldados humanos "normales", se les parecen bastante. Aunque avanzar más en inteligencia sea posible en teoría, muchos líderes políticos son reticentes a permitirles a los científicos que aumenten más las capacidades mentales de los ciborgs, pues temen que unos organismos más listos decidan rebelarse contra sus creadores y vengarse de quienes les han esclavizado. Algunos generales, exasperados, creen que este llamado síndrome "Battlestar Galactica" (en honor a la serie de televisión estadounidense de principios del s. XXI) no son más que paparruchas, pero hasta el momento no han conseguido imponer su punto de vist

TEXT.English: [TAB]The "hypaspitai" (or "shield bearers") were elite foot guardsmen in Alexander's Macedonian army. They often fought on the right flank of the "Companion Cavalry," a place of honor in most Greek armies. They were highly mobile for their time, and Alexander used this to great advantage at battles such as Chaeronea in 338 BC. [PARAGRAPH:2:1]The first hypaspists were raised from the kingdom of Macedonia on a provincial basis by Philip II during his restructuring of the army. They were the "King's Army" rather than the army of the kingdom, owing allegiance only to the royal house. Each province was required to provide a single "taxis," or regiment, made up of highly-trained commoners. Command of these regiments was usually entrusted to nobles originating from the same area as the troops themselves. When he came to the throne, however, Alexander ended this noble-based leadership, and new commanders were drawn from the regiments themselves, promoted strictly on merit rather than on family connections. By the time of his invasion of Persia the hypaspists numbered approximately 3000 men organized into three units. [PARAGRAPH:2:1]In battle the hypaspists' primary weapon was the "sarissai," an extra-long spear or pike reserved for their use. Carrying a very small shield and wearing the traditional helmets and greaves, individually they were relatively lightly-armored for the age. However, when formed into a phalanx, these soldiers were particularly deadly to the sword-armed troops that Alexander usually faced. [PARAGRAPH:2:1]Alexander favored battle tactics that were aimed at forcing a quick decision on the field. The young general employed unexpected maneuvers and sudden charges to break the morale of the enemy and create panic among enemy units not yet engaged; drilled in rapid movement in formation and legendary for their ferocity, the hypaspists were the perfect infantry for Alexander's army.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Les "hypaspistes" (ou "porteurs de boucliers") constituent l'infanterie d'élite dans l'armée macédonienne d'Alexandre. Ils combattent souvent sur le flanc droit de la "cavalerie des compagnons", place d'honneur dans la plupart des armées grecques. Ils sont très mobiles pour l'époque et Alexandre tire parti de cet avantage dans des batailles comme Chéronée en 338 av. J.-C. [PARAGRAPH:2:1]Les premiers hypaspistes sont recrutés dans le royaume de Macédoine selon une certaine proportion par région sur l'ordre de Philippe II au moment où il restructure son armée. Ils constituent l'Armée du Roi plutôt que celle du royaume, ne devant allégeance qu'à la maison royale. Chaque province doit procurer un unique taxis, ou régiment, formé d'hommes du peuple très entraînés. Le commandement de ces troupes est généralement confié à des nobles venus des mêmes régions que les soldats. Quand il accède au trône, Alexandre change ce point précis. Ainsi, les nouveaux commandants sont issus des régiments eux-mêmes et ne doivent leur promotion qu'à leur valeur, et non à l'influence de leur famille. Au moment de l'invasion de la Perse, l'armée d'Alexandre compte environ 3000 hypaspistes, regroupés au sein de trois unités. [PARAGRAPH:2:1]Au combat, l'arme principale des hypaspistes est la "sarissai", une lance ou pique extrêmement longue dont ils sont les seuls à se servir. Equipés d'un bouclier très petit et portant les traditionnels casque et grèves, ils sont peu protégés par rapport à ce qui se fait à l'époque. Toutefois, lorsqu'ils se regroupent en phalange, ces soldats deviennent redoutables face aux troupes combattant à l'épée qu'Alexandre a l'habitude d'affronter. [PARAGRAPH:2:1]Alexandre affectionne tout particulière les tactiques de combat dont le but est d'obliger l'ennemi à réagir rapidement. Le jeune général emploie ainsi des manoeuvres inattendues et des charges soudaines pour briser le moral de ses ennemis et faire paniquer les adversaires qui n'ont pas encore pris part au combat. Entraînés à se déplacer rapidement en formation et d'une férocité légendaire, les hypaspistes constituent l'infanterie idéale pour l'armée d'Alexandre.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die "Hypaspitai" (Schildträger) stellten die Elite-Fußwachsoldaten in Alexanders makedonischer Armee. Häufig kämpften sie an der rechten Flanke der "Begleitkavallerie", was in den meisten griechischen Armeen einem Ehrenplatz gleichkam. Sie waren im Vergleich zu anderen Fußsoldaten dieses Zeitalters äußerst wendig - ein Umstand, den Alexander im Gefecht, beispielsweise in der Schlacht von Chaironea im Jahr 338 vor Christus, zu seinem Vorteil nutzte. [PARAGRAPH:2:1]Die ersten Hypaspisten wurden im Rahmen der Neustrukturierung seines Heeres von Philipp II. aus den Provinzen des Königreichs Makedonien rekrutiert. Sie galten eher als die "Armee des Königs" als die Armee des Königreichs, denn sie waren ausschließlich dem Königshaus verantwortlich. Jede Provinz musste eine einzelne "Taxis" (Regiment) stellen, die sich aus gut ausgebildeten Bürgern zusammensetzte. Die Befehlsgewalt über diese Regimenter oblag in der Regel Edelleuten, die aus der gleichen Region stammten wie die Truppen selbst. Als Alexander den Thron bestieg, hatte diese Führungsstruktur der Adligen jedoch ein Ende: Er ging dazu über, die neuen Kommandanten direkt aus den Regimentern zu bestimmen, wobei die Beförderung strikt von den Verdiensten der betreffenden Person abhing und weniger von der familiären Abstammung. Zum Zeitpunkt der Invasion in das Perserreich zählten die Hypaspisten etwa 3.000 Männer, die in drei Regimenter aufgeteilt waren. [PARAGRAPH:2:1]Die Primärwaffen der Hypaspisten waren die "Sarissai", besonders lange Speere oder Piken, deren Nutzung ausschließlich ihnen vorbehalten war. Mit einem sehr kleinen Schild sowie den traditionellen Helmen und Beinschienen ausgestattet, waren sie für dieses Zeitalter verhältnismäßig leicht gerüstet. Wenn sie sich allerdings zu einer Phalanx formierten, waren sie für feindliche Schwertkämpfer, die Alexander vornehmlich angriff, besonders gefährlich. [PARAGRAPH:2:1]Alexander bevorzugte Kampftaktiken, die schnelle Entscheidungen auf dem Schlachtfeld erforderten. Vielfach setzte der junge Heerführer unerwartete Manöver und plötzliche Offensiven ein, um die Moral der gegnerischen Truppen zu brechen und auch Panik bei den Einheiten auszulösen, die noch gar nicht am Kampfgeschehen beteiligt waren. Angesichts der Tatsache, dass sie für schnelle Formationsvorstöße ausgebildet waren und über legendäre Schlagkraft verfügten, bildeten die Hypaspisten die perfekte Infanterie für Alexanders Streitmacht.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Gli "hypaspisti" (o "portatori di scudi") erano guardie di fanteria dell'esercito macedone di Alessandro. Spesso combattevano sul fianco destro della "cavalleria di supporto", una posizione d'onore nella maggior parte degli eserciti greci. Si trattava di unità molto rapide per l'epoca e Alessandro le sfruttò al massimo nelle battaglie, in particolare in quella di Cheronea, nel 338 a.C. [PARAGRAPH:2:1]I primi hypaspisti vennero addestrati nel regno di Macedonia da Filippo II durante la ristrutturazione degli eserciti e fungevano da "esercito del re", più che del regno stesso, poiché giuravano fedeltà solamente alla casa reale. Ciascuna provincia doveva fornire una singola "taxis" o reggimento, formato da cittadini comuni altamente addestrati. Il comando di questi reggimenti era in genere assegnato a nobili originari delle stesse regioni dei soldati. Raggiunto il potere, Alessandro pose fine a questo controllo nobiliare e i comandanti furono scelti all'interno dell'esercito stesso e promossi in base ai meriti, piuttosto che per via di legami familiari. Durante la campagna di Persia, gli hypaspisti impiegati furono circa 3.000, divisi in tre unità. [PARAGRAPH:2:1]In battaglia, l'arma principale degli hypaspisti era la "sarissa", una lancia molto lunga; essi inoltre imbracciavano uno scudo molto piccolo, oltre a elmi tradizionali e schinieri: per l'epoca, si trattava di unità con armamenti molto leggeri. Tuttavia, quando formavano una falange, questi soldati erano particolarmente letali contro le truppe armate di sole spade che generalmente venivano affrontate da Alessandro. [PARAGRAPH:2:1]Alessandro prediligeva l'impiego di tattiche da combattimento che costringevano a rapide decisioni sul campo di battaglia: il giovane generale utilizzava delle strategie inaspettate e ricorreva a cariche improvvise per demoralizzare il nemico e seminare il panico tra tutte le altre unità non ingaggiate in combattimento. Addestrati per muoversi rapidamente in formazione e leggendari per la loro ferocia, gli hypaspisti erano la fanteria perfetta per l'esercito di Alessandro.[PARAGRAPH:2:1]I primi hypaspisti vennero addestrati nel regno di Macedonia da Filippo II durante la ristrutturazione degli eserciti e fungevano da "esercito del re", più che del regno stesso, poiché giuravano fedeltà solamente alla casa reale. Ciascuna provincia doveva fornire una singola "taxis" o reggimento, formato da cittadini comuni altamente addestrati. Il comando di questi reggimenti era in genere assegnato a nobili originari delle stesse regioni dei soldati. Raggiunto il potere, Alessandro pose fine a questo controllo nobiliare e i comandanti furono scelti all'interno dell'esercito stesso e promossi in base ai meriti, piuttosto che per via di legami familiari. Durante la campagna di Persia, gli hypaspisti impiegati furono circa 3.000, divisi in tre unità.[PARAGRAPH:2:1]In battaglia, l'arma principale degli hypaspisti era la "sarissa", una lancia molto lunga; essi inoltre imbracciavano uno scudo molto piccolo, oltre a elmi tradizionali e schinieri: per l'epoca, si trattava di unità con armamenti molto leggeri. Tuttavia, quando formavano una falange, questi soldati erano particolarmente letali contro le truppe armate di sole spade che generalmente venivano affrontate da Alessandro.[PARAGRAPH:2:1]Alessandro prediligeva l'impiego di tattiche da combattimento che costringevano a rapide decisioni sul campo di battaglia: il giovane generale utilizzava delle strategie inaspettate e ricorreva a cariche improvvise per demoralizzare il nemico e seminare il panico tra tutte le altre unità non ingaggiate in combattimento. Addestrati per muoversi rapidamente in formazione e leggendari per la loro ferocia, gli hypaspisti erano la fanteria perfetta per l'esercito di Alessandro.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Los "hypaspitai" (o "portadores de escudo") eran infantes de élite en el ejército macedonio de Alejandro. A menudo luchaban en el flanco derecho de la "caballería de los Compañeros" un lugar de honor en la mayoría de los ejércitos griegos. Gozaban de una gran movilidad para su época y Alejandro los lideró con gran eficiencia en batallas como la de Queronea (338 a. C). [PARAGRAPH:2:1]Los primeros hipaspistas eran unidades de base provincial que empezaron a ser reclutadas por Filipo II tras su reestructuración del ejército. Más que un ejército del reino, eran el "ejército del Rey" pues solo le debían lealtad a la casa real. Cada provincia debía proporcionar un "taxis" o regimiento compuesto de plebeyos entrenados. El mando de estas unidades se encomendaba normalmente a nobles oriundos de la misma región que las tropas. Sin embargo, cuando llegó al trono, Alejandro terminó con este sistema de mando nobiliario y empezó a extraer a los comandantes de las unidades de las filas de los propios regimientos, con criterios puramente meritocráticos y no por conexiones familiares. Al inicio de la invasión de Persia, los hipaspistas eran aproximadamente tres mil hombres organizados en tres unidades. [PARAGRAPH:2:1]En la batalla, el arma principal de los hipaspistas era la "sarissai", una lanza extra larga o pica cuyo uso les estaba reservado. Con un pequeño escudo y el yelmo y las grebas tradicionales, puede decirse que estaban poco armados para lo que era habitual en su época. Sin embargo, organizados en una falange, estos soldados eran especialmente letales para las tropas armadas con espada a las que Alejandro solía enfrentarse. [PARAGRAPH:2:1]Alejandro solía emplear tácticas encaminadas a forzar una rápida decisión en el campo de batalla. El joven general empleaba maniobras inesperadas y cargas sorpresa para quebrantar la moral del enemigo y provocar el pánico de las unidades enemigas que todavía no habían entrado en combate. Entrenados para moverse con rapidez y legendarios por su ferocidad, los hipaspistas eran la infantería perfecta para el ejército de Alejandro.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Stiletto is a prototype naval ship. It is notable for its hull design and carbon fiber construction, as well as its networked architecture. The 88-foot (27 m) long vessel has a notable hull design, an M-shaped hull that provides a stable yet fast platform for mounting electronic surveillance equipment or weapons, or for conducting special operations. The hull design does not require foils or lifting devices to achieve a smooth ride at high speeds in rough conditions. Its shallow draft means the M80 Stiletto can operate in littoral and riverine environments and potentially allows for beach landings. It has a topside flight deck for launching and retrieving UAVs and a rear ramp that can launch and recover an 11-meter rigid-hull inflatable boat (RIB) or Autonomous Underwater Vehicle (AUV). [PARAGRAPH:1]Historically, ships have evolved to become narrower and deeper to achieve speed and stability. The M Hull represents a true breakthrough because its distinctively wide hull captures the vessels bow wave and redirects the energy under the hull. The Stilettos double-M hull enables the craft to achieve an unequaled ride in rough seas at high speed, which is critical for the Navy SEALS and other Special Operations Forces, because it reduces the G-forces and related injuries these personnel are subjected to during training and on missions.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Mali cavalry units called Mandekalu served as an important element of the army. Then as today, horses were expensive and only the nobles took them into battle.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Auxiliaries formed the standing non-citizen corps of the Roman army of the Principate (30 BC - 284 AD), alongside the citizen legions. By the 2nd century, the auxilia contained the same number of infantry as the legions and in addition provided almost all the Roman army's cavalry and more specialised troops (especially light cavalry and archers). The auxilia thus represented three-fifths of Rome's regular land forces at that time.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Equites (or Horseman) were riding bare-back with a simple halter to control their mounts. They wear no armour, just a short tunic and used spear as their weapon.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Landing Ship, Tank was the military designation for naval vessels created during World War II to support amphibious operations by carrying significant quantities of vehicles, cargo, and landing troops directly onto an unimproved shore.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Extraction Facility is more advanced offshore platform designed for mining mineral and methane gas deposits from deep ocean floor.

TEXT.English: [TAB]An offshore platform or oil rig is a large structure used to house workers and machinery needed to drill and/or produce oil and natural gas through wells in the ocean bed. Depending on the circumstances, the platform may be attached to the ocean floor, consist of an artificial island, or be floating. Generally, oil platforms are located on the continental shelf, though as technology improves, drilling and production in deeper waters becomes both feasible and profitable. A typical platform may have around thirty wellheads located on the platform and directional drilling allows reservoirs to be accessed at both different depths and at remote positions up to 5 miles (8 kilometres) from the platform. Larger lake- and sea-based oil platforms and oil rigs are some of the largest moveable man-made structures in the world.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The first aircraft to incorporate the principles of the jet engine was the Coanda-1910. Its engine, unlike modern jet engines, used a piston engine rather than a turbine to drive its compressor. The aircraft crashed during its first and only demonstration but remained intact. The first true turbine-equipped jetplane was the Heinkel He 178 (Germany), piloted by Erich Warsitz on August 27, 1939. The first operational jet fighter was the Messerschmitt Me 262, piloted by Fritz Wendel. It was the fastest conventional aircraft of World War II - only the rocket-powered Messerschmitt Me 163 Komet was faster. Mass production started in 1944, too late for a decisive impact on the outcome of the war. About the same time, the United Kingdom's Gloster Meteor made up the first operational jet fighter squadron in 1944. It was used to defend the UK against the V1 flying bomb and in ground-attack operations over Europe towards the end of the war. The Imperial Japanese Navy also developed jet aircraft in 1945, including the Nakajima J9Y Kikka, partially inspired by German designs.

The first true turbine-equipped jetplane was the Heinkel He 178 (Germany), piloted by Erich Warsitz on August 27, 1939. The first operational jet fighter was the Messerschmitt Me 262, piloted by Fritz Wendel. It was the fastest conventional aircraft of World War II - only the rocket-powered Messerschmitt Me 163 Komet was faster. Mass production started in 1944, too late for a decisive impact on the outcome of the war. About the same time, the United Kingdom's Gloster Meteor made up the first operational jet fighter squadron in 1944. It was used to defend the UK against the V1 flying bomb and in ground-attack operations over Europe towards the end of the war. The Imperial Japanese Navy also developed jet aircraft in 1945, including the Nakajima J9Y Kikka, partially inspired by German designs.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A strike fighter is a fighter aircraft which is also capable of attacking surface targets, including ships. It differs from an attack aircraft in that the aircraft remains a capable fighter. Previously, an airstrike on a ground target would usually involve bombers, defended by fighters. Strike-fighters can attack targets unaided, while remaining maneuverable and well-equipped enough to defend themselves.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The first steam-powered screw frigates were built in the mid-1840s, and at the end of the decade the French Navy introduced steam power to its line of battle. The desire for change came from the ambition of Napoleon III to gain greater influence in Europe, which required a challenge to the British at sea. The introduction of the steam ship-of-the-line led to a building competition between France and Britain. By the end of the 1850s it was clear that France was unable to match British building of steam warships, and to regain the strategic initiative a dramatic change was required. The result was the first ocean-going ironclad, the La Gloire, begun in 1857 and launched in 1859. Britain's venture into iron was not in the form of an ironclad (a wooden hull armour plated) but the world's first all iron ship, (iron hull, armour plated) HMS Warrior. The Royal Navy had not been keen to sacrifice their advantage in steam ships of the line, but was determined that the first British iron ship would outmatch the French ships in every respect, particularly speed. A fast iron ship would have the advantage of being able to choose a range of engagement which could make her invulnerable to enemy fire. The British specification was more a large, powerful frigate than a ship-of-the-line. The resulting vessel was Warrior, built and launched in 1860, Britain's first iron warship. Warrior was a successful design; her weapons and armor were more effective than that of La Gloire, and with the largest set of steam engines yet fitted to a ship she could steam at 14.3 knots.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The first jeep prototype (the Bantam BRC) was built for the Department of the Army by American Bantam in Butler, Pennsylvania, followed by two other competing prototypes produced by Ford and Willys-Overland. The American Bantam Car Company actually built and designed the vehicle that first met the Army's criteria, but its engine did not meet the Army's torque requirements. Plus, the Army felt that the company was too small to supply the number needed and it allowed Willys and Ford to make second attempts on their designs after seeing Bantam's vehicle in action. Quantities (1,500) of each of the three models were then extensively field tested. During the bidding process for 16,000 "jeeps," Willys-Overland offered the lowest bid and won the initial contract. Willys thus designed what would become the standardized jeep.

TEXT.English: Eagle warriors were a special class of infantry soldier of the Aztec army. Along with the Jaguar warriors, Eagle warriors were the only Aztec warrior society for which access was not restricted to the nobility, but to which even commoners could be admitted for special merit.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Lockheed SR-71 is an advanced, long-range, Mach 3 strategic reconnaissance aircraft developed from the Lockheed YF-12A and A-12 aircraft by the Lockheed Skunk Works. The SR-71 was unofficially named the Blackbird, and called the Habu by its crews. Clarence "Kelly" Johnson was responsible for many of the design's advanced concepts. A defensive feature of the aircraft was its high speed and operating altitude, whereby, if a surface-to-air missile launch were detected, standard evasive action was simply to accelerate. The SR-71 line was in service from 1964 to 1998, with 12 of the 32 aircraft being destroyed in accidents, though none were lost to enemy action.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The Fieseler Fi 103, better known as V-1 was the first guided missile used in war and the forerunner of today's cruise missile. The V-1 was developed by the German Luftwaffe during the Second World War. Between June 1944 and March 29, 1945, it was fired at targets in southeastern England and Belgium e.g. London and Antwerp. V-1s were launched from "ski" launch sites along the French (Pas-de-Calais) and Dutch coasts until the sites were overrun by Allied forces. The underground V-1 storage depots at Saint-Leu-d'Esserent, Nucourt and Rilly-la-Montagne, as well as the launch sites, were bombed during Operation Crossbow.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The M270 Multiple Launch Rocket System (M270 MLRS) is a MLRS, a type of rocket artillery. The first rocket systems were delivered to the U.S. Army in 1983. The system is in widespread use in the NATO countries and it has also been manufactured in Europe. Some 1,300 M270 systems have been manufactured, along with more than 700,000 rockets. The system has been used in the Gulf wars, where it proved itself as a practical and effective weapons system. The production of the M270 ended in 2003, when a last batch was delivered to the Egyptian army. [PARAGRAPH:2]The system is capable of firing guided and unguided projectiles to a distance of up to 42 km (26.1 miles). Firing ballistic missile, (such as the U.S. Army Tactical Missile SystemATACMS) it is capable of reaching out to 300 km (186 miles) with the warhead reaching a maximal altitude of about 50 km (164,000 ft). The M270 is a very mobile unit, thus well suited for the so called shoot-and-scoot tactic: it can fire its rockets very rapidly and immediately move away to avoid the counter-battery fire. [PARAGRAPH:2]The rockets and ATACMS missiles are contained in interchangeable pods. Each pod contains six standard rockets or one guided ATACMS missile (the two types cannot be mixed). The launcher can hold two pods at a time, which it loads using an integrated crane. All twelve rockets or two ATACMS missiles can be fired in under a minute. One launcher firing twelve rockets can completely blanket one square kilometer with submunitions. For this reason, the MLRS is sometimes referred to as the "Grid Square Removal Service".

TEXT.English: [TAB]Medic is a general term for a person involved in medicine, especially emergency or first-response medicine, such as an Emergency Medical Technician, Paramedic, or a military member trained in battlefield medicine. It may also refer to a medical student or, in limited settings, a physician. Unless in a paramedical setting, the term is not applied to a nurse.

It may also refer to a medical student or, in limited settings, a physician. Unless in a paramedical setting, the term is not applied to a nurse.

TEXT.English: [TAB]In most countries special forces (SF) is a generic term for highly-trained military units that conduct specialized operations such as reconnaissance, unconventional warfare, and counter-terrorism actions. Some special forces operations, such as counter-terrorism actions, may be carried out domestically under certain circumstances. Special forces units are typically composed of relatively small groups of highly-trained personnel equipped with specialist equipment and armament, operating under principles of self-sufficiency, stealth, speed, and close teamwork, often transported by helicopter, small boats or submarines, parachuting from aircraft, or stealthy infiltration by land. Special forces are sometimes considered a force multiplier, as when they train indigenous forces to fight guerrilla warfare. Special forces have played an important role throughout the history of warfare when the aim has been to achieve disruption by "hit and run" and sabotage, rather than more traditional face-to-face combat. Other significant roles lay in reconnaissance, providing essential intelligence from close to or among the enemy, and increasingly in combating terrorists, their infrastructure and activities.
TEXT.French: [TAB]In most countries special forces (SF) is a generic term for highly-trained military units that conduct specialized operations such as reconnaissance, unconventional warfare, and counter-terrorism actions. Some special forces operations, such as counter-terrorism actions, may be carried out domestically under certain circumstances. Special forces units are typically composed of relatively small groups of highly-trained personnel equipped with specialist equipment and armament, operating under principles of self-sufficiency, stealth, speed, and close teamwork, often transported by helicopter, small boats or submarines, parachuting from aircraft, or stealthy infiltration by land. Special forces are sometimes considered a force multiplier, as when they train indigenous forces to fight guerrilla warfare. Special forces have played an important role throughout the history of warfare when the aim has been to achieve disruption by "hit and run" and sabotage, rather than more traditional face-to-face combat. Other significant roles lay in reconnaissance, providing essential intelligence from close to or among the enemy, and increasingly in combating terrorists, their infrastructure and activities.

TEXT.English: [TAB]A scramjet (supersonic combustion ramjet) is a variation of a ramjet with the key difference being that the flow in the combustor is supersonic. At higher speeds it is necessary to combust supersonically to maximize the efficiency of the combustion process. Projections for the top speed of a scramjet engine (without additional oxidiser input) vary between Mach 12 and Mach 24 (orbital velocity), but the X-30 research gave Mach 17 due to combustion rate issues. By way of contrast, the fastest conventional air-breathing, manned vehicles, such as the U.S. Air Force SR-71, achieve approximately Mach 3.4 and rockets achieved Mach 30+ during the Apollo Program. [PARAGRAPH:2]Like a ramjet, a scramjet essentially consists of a constricted tube through which inlet air is compressed by the high speed of the vehicle, a combustion chamber where fuel is combusted, and a nozzle through which the exhaust jet leaves at higher speed than the inlet air. Also like a ramjet, there are few or no moving parts. In particular there is no high speed turbine as in a turbofan or turbojet engine that is expensive to produce and can be a major point of failure. [PARAGRAPH:2]A scramjet requires supersonic airflow through the engine, thus, similar to a ramjet, scramjets have a minimum functional speed. This speed is uncertain due to the low number of working scramjets, relative youth of the field, and the largely classified nature of research using complete scramjet engines. However, it is likely to be at least Mach 5 for a pure scramjet, with higher Mach numbers (between 7 and 9) more likely. Thus scramjets require acceleration to hypersonic speed via other means. A hybrid ramjet or scramjet would have a lower minimum functional Mach number, and some sources indicate the NASA X-43A research vehicle is a hybrid design. Recent tests of prototypes have used a booster rocket to obtain the necessary velocity. Air breathing engines should have significantly better specific impulse while within the atmosphere than rocket engines.

TEXT.English: [TAB]Modern flamethrowers were first used during the trench warfare conditions of World War I; their use greatly increased in World War II. They can be vehicle mounted, as on a tank, or hand-carried by infantry.[PARAGRAPH:2]The flamethrower consists of two elements: backpack and gun. The backpack element usually consists of two or three cylinders. One cylinder holds compressed, inert propellant gas (usually nitrogen), and the other two hold inflammable liquid - typically petrol with some form of fuel thickener added to it. A three-cylinder system often has two outer cylinders of inflammable liquid and a central cylinder of propellant gas to improve the balance of the soldier who carried it. The gas propels the fuel liquid out of the cylinder through a flexible pipe and then into the gun element of the flamethrower system. The gun consists of a small reservoir, a spring-loaded valve, and an ignition system; depressing a trigger opens the valve, allowing pressurized inflammable liquid to flow and pass over the igniter and out the gun nozzle. The igniter can be one of several ignition systems: A simple type is an electrically-heated wire coil; another used a small pilot flame, fueled with pressurized gas from the system.[PARAGRAPH:2]The flamethrower is a potent weapon with great psychological impact upon unprepared soldiers, inflicting a particularly horrific death i.e. being burnt alive. This has led to some calls for the weapon to be banned. It is primarily used against battlefield fortifications, bunkers, and other protected emplacements. A flamethrower projects a stream of flammable liquid, rather than flame, which allows bouncing the stream off walls and ceilings to project the fire into blind and unseen spaces, such as inside bunkers or pillboxes. Typically, popular visual media depict the flamethrower as short-ranged, of a few effective meters (due to the common use of propane gas as the fuel in flamethrowers in movies, for the safety of the actors), but contemporary flamethrowers can incinerate targets at 5080 meters (165270 feet) distance from the gunner; moreover, an unignited stream of flammable liquid can be fired and afterwards ignited, possibly by a lamp or other flame inside the bunker.[PARAGRAPH:2]Flamethrowers pose many risks to the operator. The first disadvantage is the weapon's weight, which impairs the soldier's mobility. Flamethrowers are very visible in the battlefield, and so operators become prominent targets for snipers. Historically, flamethrower operators were rarely taken prisoner, especially when their targets survived attack by the weapon; in reprisal, captured flamethrower users often were summarily executed. Finally, the flamethrower's effective range is short in comparison with that of other battlefield weapons of similar size. To be effective, flamethrower soldiers must approach their targets closely, risking exposing themselves to close enemy fire. Vehicular flamethrowers also have this problem; they may have considerably greater range than a man-portable flamethrower, but their range is still short compared with that of even infantry firearms.

TEXT.English: [TAB]The King George V-class battleships (KGV) were the penultimate battleship design completed for the Royal Navy (RN). Five ships of the class were commissioned: King George V (1940), Prince of Wales (1941), Duke of York (1941), Howe (1942), and Anson (1942). They carried one quadruple and one high "super-firing" twin turret forward and one quadruple turret aft. In this unique layout, she carried ten 14-inch guns. Her secondary armament consisted of sixteen 5.25 inch guns clustered amidships in eight double turrets.[PARAGRAPH:2]The five battleships of the King George V class were the most modern in service with the Royal Navy in WWII. All five rendered invaluable service in the two-ocean war and could in fact be credited with helping to influence policy of the war itself. The best example of their importance was their critical role in the chase and sinking of Hitler's battleship Bismarck; a loss that significantly altered German Naval policy toward increased reliance on its U-boat arm.[PARAGRAPH:2]The other significant impact in the war the Sinking of Prince of Wales and Repulse, which was a World War II naval engagement illustrating the effectiveness of aerial attacks against naval forces that were not protected by air cover and the resulting importance of including an aircraft carrier in any major fleet action.[PARAGRAPH:2]The action took place east of Malaya, near Kuantan, Pahang where the British battleship HMS Prince of Wales and battlecruiser HMS Repulse were attacked by Imperial Japanese Navy land-based bombers and torpedo bombers.[PARAGRAPH:2]The two ships were the first capital ships actively defending themselves to be sunk solely by airpower while steaming on the open sea. This incident demonstrated the vulnerability of even the most modern surface ships to the potency of air attack and drove home the necessity of air cover to protect against such an incident.[PARAGRAPH:2]Following the end of World War Two, the remaining battleships of the King George V Class had become obsolete and expensive to run. In 1950 the class was laid up in reserve in Gareloch. The scrapping of the class was approved in 1957.

The best example of their importance was their critical role in the chase and sinking of Hitler's battleship Bismarck; a loss that significantly altered German Naval policy toward increased reliance on its U-boat arm.[PARAGRAPH:2]The other significant impact in the war the Sinking of Prince of Wales and Repulse, which was a World War II naval engagement illustrating the effectiveness of aerial attacks against naval forces that were not protected by air cover and the resulting importance of including an aircraft carrier in any major fleet action.[PARAGRAPH:2]The action took place east of Malaya, near Kuantan, Pahang where the British battleship HMS Prince of Wales and battlecruiser HMS Repulse were attacked by Imperial Japanese Navy land-based bombers and torpedo bombers.[PARAGRAPH:2]The two ships were the first capital ships actively defending themselves to be sunk solely by airpower while steaming on the open sea. This incident demonstrated the vulnerability of even the most modern surface ships to the potency of air attack and drove home the necessity of air cover to protect against such an incident.[PARAGRAPH:2]Following the end of World War Two, the remaining battleships of the King George V Class had become obsolete and expensive to run. In 1950 the class was laid up in reserve in Gareloch. The scrapping of the class was approved in 1957.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]The King George V-class battleships (KGV) were the penultimate battleship design completed for the Royal Navy (RN). Five ships of the class were commissioned: King George V (1940), Prince of Wales (1941), Duke of York (1941), Howe (1942), and Anson (1942). They carried one quadruple and one high "super-firing" twin turret forward and one quadruple turret aft. In this unique layout, she carried ten 14-inch guns. Her secondary armament consisted of sixteen 5.25 inch guns clustered amidships in eight double turrets.[PARAGRAPH:2]The five battleships of the King George V class were the most modern in service with the Royal Navy in WWII. All five rendered invaluable service in the two-ocean war and could in fact be credited with helping to influence policy of the war itself. The best example of their importance was their critical role in the chase and sinking of Hitler's battleship Bismarck; a loss that significantly altered German Naval policy toward increased reliance on its U-boat arm.[PARAGRAPH:2]The other significant impact in the war the Sinking of Prince of Wales and Repulse, which was a World War II naval engagement illustrating the effectiveness of aerial attacks against naval forces that were not protected by air cover and the resulting importance of including an aircraft carrier in any major fleet action.[PARAGRAPH:2]The action took place east of Malaya, near Kuantan, Pahang where the British battleship HMS Prince of Wales and battlecruiser HMS Repulse were attacked by Imperial Japanese Navy land-based bombers and torpedo bombers.[PARAGRAPH:2]The two ships were the first capital ships actively defending themselves to be sunk solely by airpower while steaming on the open sea. This incident demonstrated the vulnerability of even the most modern surface ships to the potency of air attack and drove home the necessity of air cover to protect against such an incident.[PARAGRAPH:2]Following the end of World War Two, the remaining battleships of the King George V Class had become obsolete and expensive to run. In 1950 the class was laid up in reserve in Gareloch. The scrapping of the class was approved in 1957.
